text:
Tap @Mondial de la biere 2017, Montreal.
Small beige head, very dark brown colour. Aroma: roasted malts, coffee.
Sweet taste, full body, long finish, flat. A little bit too sweet.

Pours black with a medium tan head. Aroma has smoky/peaty malts, some coffee and dark fruits, a touch of sweet molasses/burnt sugar. Flavor follows suit...dark fruits are accentuated...some bitter dark chocolate and earthy/woody notes. Mouthfeel is light/medium and slightly syrupy with a dry, roasty finish.

Bottle, thanks to Yourilevesque. 2016 product. Opaque dark brown with smallish foamy tan head, woodsy mocha aroma, medium carbonation, sweetish mocha taste with wood flavor, and bit of sourness, smooth thickish body, long mocha finish. Very very smooth and well covered alcohol content. Great brew!

Pours black with quickly disappearing head. Aroma is roasted malts, smoked malts, nuts, a tiny bit of alcohol, coffee and chocolate. More like an imperial stout than a baltic porter. Body is huge, a lot of dark notes in the taste, molasses, amaretto. Very nice, although non-traditional, baltic porter.
On tap, of a completely black colour and dark head. Coffee, chocolate and nuts aroma. Tastes even better than it smells, alcohol goes almost unnoticed. Brilliant

Noire dense, petit collet de tres fines bulles
Aromes puissants, chocolat, cafe, moka, melasse
Tres belle cohésion des saveurs torrefiees, une pointe de liqueur cherry

Wygląd: ciemne, nieprzejrzyste, brunatna drobnopecherzykowa piana - pozostaje po niej pierścień 
Aromat: czerwone owoce, pumpernikiel, suszone owoce, troche wanilii, czekolada, sliwka 
Smak: pełne, gładkie, oleiste, suszone czerwone owoce, śliwka, czekolada, palonosc, słodkie, przyjemna goryczka, nasycenie srednie, alkohol swietnie ukryty

Rami Rami is drinking a Porter Baltique by Les Trois Mousquetaires - LTM

A) bez sosu nie ma sztosu b) chleb ciemny / pumpernikel c) ciemne owoce d) team slodyczka e) bardzo mi smakuje

W aromacie intensywne suszone owoce, cimny chleb ze śliwką, czekolada - niesamowita intensywność i złożoność. W smaku podobnie, czarny chleb z owocami, nutka umami, czekolada, pełne, gładkie, nie do pomylenia z niczym innym. Polskie bałtyki ssą. Ten jest wybitny.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Whoah. Jak połączenie dobrego Bałtyka i Pannepot.

Kolor czarny, beżowa, szybko opadająca piana. W aromacie karmel, skórka od chleba, rodzynki. W smaku jest zdecydowanie słodko. Rodzynki, skórka od chleba, karmel, trochę kawy zbożowej. Fajny balans, alkohol ukryty. Bardzo dobre piwo, powiedziałbym nawet, że zaskakująco dobre. Mogę stwierdzić, że w Kanadzie kumają czym jest porter bałtycki.
Bardzo fajna slodycz, karmel, owoce. Petarda porterek, oby takich wiecej bylo

Black, small head. Aroma: malty, chocolate, tomatoes (oxydation), coffee, nuts. Full body, heavy sweetness, low to medium bitterness. Flavour sweet coffee, malt, nuts. Nice hidden alcohol. Overall average.
Tirador al BBF17. Cervesa negra amb poca escuma. Aromes de xocolata, fruits secs, avellanes, xocolata negra... Densa en boca i de final molt llarg amb regust dolç i amarg molt agradable. Boníssima!

Bottle into glass. Strong coffee and dark chocolate aromas. Medium bitter taste. Pours black with tan head. Full bodied with smooth texture. If you like strong coffee and dark chocolate youll probably like this.

W aromacie trochę zielonego jabłka, ale też na szczęście trochę mlecznej czekolady przykrywającej to jabłko. W smaku jest płytko, niewiele się dzieje. Jedyne co się wybija to lody czekoladowe. Aftertaste troszkę męczący po jakimś czasie z uwagi na sporą goryczkę.

Pite w Carpe Kraft w ramach panelu. Bardzo ładny wygląd, gęsta czapa beżowej piany, utrzymuje się długo, czarne i gęste. W aromacie praliny, wanilia, czekolada. Słodycz mocna wraz z wanilią komponuje się idealnie, przywodzi na myśl płynne ptasie mleczko, rozgrzewający alkohol również pasuje, co ciekawe na końcu wchodzi fajna popiołowość.

Bottled. Small sample. The aroma has tobacco, roast, chocolate. Black coloured beer with a medium sized, beige head. The taste is light bitter and moderate sweet with dried fruit, roast, ash, chocolate. Medium-full bodied beer. Very drinkable. Nice.

75cl bottle @Cimmeria, Oviedo. 16-03-2017.
BBD: not noticed. Who cares.
In short: nice porter.
Pours quite dark with some nice tan head. Moderate head retention, some lacing. Roasty, licorice, raisins, fruity nose. Medium body, soft carbonation, oily texture. Taste is some sweet, roasty, licorice, raisins, lots of dried fruits, caramel, some toffee. Good.

Botella. @Cimmeria, Oviedo 17/03/2017 
Color negro opaco corona de espuma persistente de color beige, aromas tostados con notas a regaliz, sabor tostado con un final dulce, cuerpo ligero. buena cerveza

Bottle shared at the CBC Islington for the Matteo farewell tasting. Many thanks to Daniel for this one . Mahogany brown coloured pour with a lasting thin beige head. Aroma is sweet praline, aged malts, nutty praline, coconut, chocolate. Flavour is composed of semi sweet, plum, woody, choc. Plate is medium sweet, moderate carbonation, creamy. Good
Bijna zwarte kleur met een goede kraag. Ruikt zoetig, alcohol, herfstfruit., koffie geur. Smaakt vol, zoetig, vanille, fruit, koffie.
Donker bruin bier met een kleine beige schuim kraag. Ruikt koffie, chocolade, geroosterd, mout. Smaakt zoet, kruidig, geroosterd, chocolade. Lekkah.
Supermooi, ruikt heerlijk naar chocola. Smaakt ook super. Droppig. Smooth. Lekker!

February 2017 - Bottle share at CBC Islington for the Matteo Farewell tasting, as Les Trois Mousquetaires G.C. Porter Baltique. Had this one sent over from the Netherlands. Very dark brown with a red hue, foamy brown head. Aroma is chocolate syrup, light coffee and cola. Body is light, frothy with soft carbonation. Taste is sugary, molasses, cola syrup, chocolate liqueur, intensely sugary sweet with a spicy finish. A bit disappointing when youve paid the best part of £20! But its decent. (3.6)

50cl bottle shared at my Farewell Tasting, London. Massive thanks to Daniel for this one. It pours a dark brown color with ima sa small beige head. Aroma is strong coffee and hazelnuts. Taste is also sweet and roasty with notes of caramel and hazelnuts. Medium bodiednierh good carbonation. Overall, nice one

Bottle, aged since 2014. Pours opaque black, small creamy tan head, dissipates slowly to a nice residual ring and decent lacing. Aroma is molasses, anise, a bit woody, cocoa, tobacco, leather. Flavor is medium sweet, light plus bitter, hints of smoke along with loads of raw molasses and roasted malt. Full body, creamy mouthfeel. Pretty darn good.

Bottle, 2013. Almost opaque black with small head. Aroma of chocolate, molasses, caramel, dried fruits, light berry note. In taste caramel, some chocolate and lots of sweetness and fruitiness found usually in meads, but the beer was medium dry, not as sweet at all. Full body, soft carbonation, very oily and silky on the palate. Finish was rather sweetish but not clogging. Really great beer that got with age this great mead-like fruitiness and sweetness. Great brew.

Large caged and corked bottle purchased from the brewery at the source, in Brossard, Quebec, Canada. Poured into a snifter pitch black with a thin tan head that immediately disappears. Slight lacing. Aroma is faint, but detect Kona coffee and salted caramel. Flavor is intense; where to begin: coffee, caramel, dark chocolate, black cherry, vanilla beans, slight campfire, molasses, raisins, figs, dates, almonds and filberts. If that sounds like a dessert, it is! With a thick, slick mouthfeel, this is a go-to winter sipper.

750ml bottle @ home(thanks Sergiy). 2015 VintagePours a mostly opaque black colour with a thin brown head. Nose is roasted malts, espresso, and hints of sweet dark fruits. Flavour is sweet and rich, espresso, dark fruits, very slight bitter finish with a tingling sensation on the tongue from the alcohol but no burning.

Bottle shared. Pours close to black with a small tan head. Aroma is full of dark fruits, raisins, chocolate, caramel malts and roast. Like a roasty quadrupel almost. Taste is over medium sweet and light bitter. Medium body, low carbonation.

On tap at Chinaski Levapies, Madrid on 3-Dec-2016, and served in a snifter with a side of dark chocolate (excellent!). Dark brown (almost black in colour) with a small beige coloured head. Aroma of cocao nibs, expresso and sweet malt. Full body and soft carbonation. Rich and sweet taste. Lots of chocolate, dark fruit, coffee and sweet malt. Light bitterness, smooth with a little alcohol buzz. Excellent.

UPDATED: DEC 24, 2016 Licorice, coffee and chocolate aroma. Complex and smooth with red wine flavours - surprisingly - shining through for me. Not too rich. The booze is well hidden. This was the 2013 version so it was a three year-old beer. Great stuff. Thanks Matthew!
Pours black ,small grey head. Smell is Sharp, bit sweet. Taste is full, dark malts, bit vanilla ( very hidden ) rather thick. Not too much smokyness. Not bad. Some dark fruits.
Dark black. Shared w tony b. Sweet at first then rounds out to a hint of smoke. Milky. Vanilla. Chocolate. Surprised this is 10%. Thx youri.

75cl bottle at the home of a friend in Newfoundland. Aged in his cellar for a couple of years. One of the best beers I have ever tasted. Full of molasses and sharpened raisin, this one not artificially flavoured by a couple of litres of single malt swimming around in its container. Enough beery edges to make it a credible strong porter - and lagered rather than oak-aged by the feel of it. An astonishing achievement in beer making. I would love to head-to-head it with Rochefort 10.

Out of the 750mL poured a rich deep black, opaque with a creamy persistent tan head. I got notes of rich dark chocolate, roasted nuts, coffee and dried fruits (like booze soaked raisins). Palate tended more towards dark cherry, boozy chocolate fruitcake, and hazelnuts. Rich and complex. Loved it.

UPDATED: DEC 28, 2016 05-10-2016. On tap at St. Augustines with Ash. Pours an opaque very dark brown with a brown head. Aroma and taste are sweet, roasted malt, slightly vinous, dark fruits, cherry. Almost (slightly too sweet) perfectly balanced beer. Amazing.
8-4-8-4-17=41

28-Dec-2016. 750ml bottle from Firefly Cambie at Brians. Bottled on 07-10-2015. Aroma is chocolate, dark fruits. Taste is quite sweet with the same notes. Roasted malt sweet aftertaste.
8-4-8-4-15=39

Trade with Youri. Dark dark pour with quickly dissipating chocolate head. Aroma is sweet, dark fruit and roasted malts. Flavor is much the same, but even better - more layered and nuanced with dark chocolate covered cherries, light roasted malt and coffee and a kiss of smoke and vanilla. Impressive brew. Very smooth though the strength shows.

Bottle 75cl
@ Cervezas Diferentes, Coslada, Spain.
A: Dark brown.
T: Roasted malt, sweet, chocolate.

Opaque black color with no visible activity. Well constructed creamy brown 2 finger head, lasting around 5 minutes, with average legs.

Aromas of oak, earth, caramel, and coffee. Flavors of thick fruits like cherries, dark berries, grapes, with a taste of mocha coffee and chocolate, extra earthy and oaky. Highly sweet, but delicious, with a low vinous feel.

Smooth oily light to medium body with a perfect amount of carbonation. Strong and long finish, ending with a barrel aged oak wood feel, yeasty spices, and a lingering tongue coat of dark fruits and caramel.

Overall incredibly well crafted: inviting smell, tons of delicious flavors that are well balanced and super complex, strong but still well intensified, amazing barrel aged mouth feel, good freshness from the low booziness and almost no vinous feel. The perfect appetizer.
Gout de chocolat et bien torrifié. Cest sec et très classe. Une explosion de saveur qui mériterait le titre de Vin de chocolat
This is a bit disappointing. Looks fine but the flavor is definitely on the sweet side. Almost more importantly, the alcohol is very prevalent.

Dans un premier temps, si les bières un tantinet sucrées ne tombent pas dans vos cordes, cest peut-être bien de commencer à chercher une autre bière. Si vous voulez remplacer votre prochain dessert, vous êtes tombé sur le bon breuvage! 
Chocolat sucré, vanille, fruits rouges, intensité, corps dense, chaleur dalcool... du réconfort dans une bouteille, tout simplement!

RBESG 2016 in Barcelona. On tap at NaparBCN. Nearly black colour. Sweetish aroma of malts and molasses. The molasses flavour was WAY too sweet for me - at least in a setting like this, a multiple beers tasting.

9th July 2016: on-tap at BierCaB, Barcelona with the RBESG guys: yet another beer a long way from home in Catalonia. More or less black with a beige head that soon became a wisp and collar before leaving all together I blame the lager base). Nose was all about malty molasses and the aromas they bring, the taste a sweet malty treat for those of us with a sweet tooth: liked it: pity about the head.

Tap at BierCaB. Almost black with short lasting beige head that leaves no trace. Toffee, coffee, milk chocolate, brown sugar. Very sweet and very light bitter. Over medium bodied with very soft carbonation. Lovely beer!
Bottle, 750 ml at Olhops, Valencia. Courtesy of and shared with guys from Olhops. Pours dark brown with tan head. Roasted malts, milk chocolate, raisins, cocoa, smoke notes. Quite sweet.

Tap at Le Saint-Bock in Montréal. Orangey brown with not too long lasting head. Really strange jammy-marmalady, extremely sweet aroma and flavour. Figs and oranges. Not had a BP like this before. Not sure what to make of it. A digestif - in a very good way! A bit of the booziness shows, almost feels like the sweetness is there to try and hide the 10%. Viscous and sticky. Not much roastiness going on there, nor coffee. Barely some toasty notes. More like just barley. In fact, it looks, talks and acts more like a BW than a BP. So Im judging this not as a BP but something that defies style limitations. And its good.
Pours dark black with a tan head. Notes of woody malts, bitter chocolate, and milk. Nice mouthfeel and not an overwhelmingly boozy taste for the ABV. Excellent beer. Bottle.

Big bottle from Saveure Biere cons 2016-05-28 Göteborg
AR: wee smokey, milk chocolate, espresso, 
AP: dark brown, stouty sand brown lid
F: espresso, milk chocolate, dry, wee smokey, hint if orange

Vraiment excellente, toute en équilibre, en rondeur.
Nez très chocolat, café, léger bourbon, un fond boisé/fumé.
Bouche à lattaque très caféinée, rapidement reprise par un côté bourbon assez subtil, gourmand, vanille douce. On retrouvera en finale des fruits noirs de type pruneau et de (très) légères cerises griottes.
Se boit tout seul.

750 mml bottle tasted at home on the 05/04/2016. Pours dark brown with a small tan head. Aroma is smoked malts, coffee, licorice, wood and alcohol. Taste is heavy sweet, chocolate, woods, vainilla and licorice. Intense sweet aftertaste. Next one please!
Tttttttttttttttttttttttrrrrrrreeeeeeeeeeeessssssss bbbbbbbbbbbbonnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnne!!!&

750 mL bottle. Black body. Smell is interesting. Chocolate. Nutty malts. Almost like a meaty aroma. Taste is much sweeter than expected. Chocolate is nutty with some dark fruit. Has a bit of a meaty taste, also. Not really thrilled with it. Heavy. Struggling through this a little. Really was expecting more.

Bottle. Pours black color with an average frothy tan head that was lasting with excellent lacing. Medium to heavy toasted chocolate, coffee and smoke aroma. Medium to full body with a thick smooth texture and flat carbonation. Medium to heavy toasted dark malt flavor with a medium to heavy dark sweet finish of moderate to long duration. This is a solid porter.

750ml bottle, thanks to tmoney99 for sharing. Black color. Thin tan head. 
Leaves some loose ropes of lace. Dark fruit, some milk chocolate, some molasses. Moderate to bigger sweet taste, lighter bitterness. Mild dry finish. Medium to bigger body. Kind of slick. Lighter carbonation. Solid and aromatic, but just not my style. Too sweet for me, with more molasses type flavor than Id like.

Bottle shared by Tmoney99 pour opaque dark brown with thin tan head. Nose bitter chocolate, roasted malt, sweet malt, molasses, some dark fruit. Taste initially sweet, then nice roast, chocolate, coffee, cherry. Roasted sweet finish.

Had this many times but apparently never rated it. Anyway, 750 ml bottled in January of 2013. Appearance is black with creamy head. Aroma is coffee, brown sugar, and roasted malts. Taste is bitter roast, followed by sweet coffee, dark chocolate, and a bit of sweet port like character. Finishes medium bitter, with a touch of heat. This was the first Baltic potter that I tried when I was first getting into craft beer. Its a great example of the style, and ages really well.

750ml bottle (thanks FatPhil). Deep dark brown color. Tiny to almost no head. Stays as a ring. Alcohol, sweet, malty, roast, mild hops in aroma. Sweet, malty, nutty, roast in taste. Sweet roasted malt in aftertaste. So mellow and balanced. Fantastic brew. Smooth mouthfeel.

750ml bottle - thanks martjoobolut!
Absolutely classic baltic porter aroma. Dark, brief tan head. Lovely full sweetish palate. Big bold roast, touch of tobacco, gentle smokiness. So mellow. reminds me of the 12-month baltic porter from our locals. Finish has lovely hops, dry and old, and tobacco-ey. Superb baltic porter, absolutely nailed the style.

Bottle. Pours dark brown with brownish head. The head doesnt stay. Aroma is malt, roast, ccaramel, black bread. Flavor is sweet, malty, cherry notes,  fruits, roast, vanilla, smoke. Finish is sweet and dry bitter with some warming alcohol. Overall: great brew.

Dark brown beer, small tan head. Nose is chocolate, smooth roast, hops, vanilla. Flavor fruity, dried plums, some vanilla and chocolate. Finish is smoke and leather, fruity sweetness, roast, hops. Lingering tobacco notes and something that comes off as fruity freshness. Layered and balanced, magnificent.

Ma première porter baltique, mais assurément pas ma dernière. À loeil, une robe noire opaque. Sa mousse brunâtre et persistante laisse un peu de dentelle sur mon verre. Jy détecte des arômes chocolatés, du malt mais aussi un petit penchant fumé. Après la première gorgée, je distingue du chocolat mais aussi un goût de cerise noire et de torréfaction. Aussi, une légère amertume. La texture est sirupeuse à souhait. Très agréable, cest un retournez-y.

bottle @ Party Source / Bellevue KY --- Opaque black/brown, beige head cover, tiny lace dots. Taste is lightly smoked roasted malt that moves easily through a very lightly fizzed swallow to some chocolate and dark dried fruit. Light bitterness rounds things out. A big, robust brew. Sipping is the only way I can drink more than 4-6 ozs.

Big bottle in a taster. Pours dark brown with a beige head. Aroma of darker malts with dark fruits, roast, and chocolate plus light bitterness and some bread. Flavor the same but all sort of watery. Average texture. Not a bad beer, but not good for a Baltic porter.
Super bière a deguster sur le bord du feux avec un bon roman par une journée froide dhiver! Ou avec une bonne soupe a loignon!! La bière est legerement sucré avec une bonne presence de café noir.

Draught at Boswell. Rich dark roasted flavors, lingering brown sugar, tobacco and smokey notes, silky body. A bit too boozy, but an interesting strong porter which oscillates between sweet and smokey.
Bottle at the DC Gathering. Black with light tan head. Aromas of caramel, light booze, chocolate. Tastes of chocolate, caramel, light roast. Medium-light body with a dry finish.
From a bottle at the Nov 2015 RateBeer gathering. Pours black with a tan head. Slight boozy nose. Flavors of licorice, leather and tobacco. Smooth, roast finish.

Dégustée en fût au Brouhaha. La bière se présente fièrement à moi : robe noire comme la nuit et collet blanc comme neige. Arômes chauds dun alcool fort flambé. Je note aussi du raisin bleu, de la mélasse et du tabac à pipe. En bouche le liquide est parfaitement sirupeux, collant et sucré. Beaucoup même. Les saveurs versent dans la cerise noire, le gâteau Forêt Noire, la ganache et la brioche vanillée. Ample et ronde comme ma soeur qui mange un souper du Réveillon 365 soirs par année, cette bière est délicieuse mais en petit format!

Aged 2 years. Pours black with a generous quickly fading toffee head. Aroma is chocolate, vanilla, molasses, plum, dark cherry, and roasted malts. Flavour is dark chocolate, dark dried fruit, vanilla, and subtle spices (cumin?). Moderate to full mouthfeel. Awesome Baltic porter.

750 ml. bottle (about 75 %) @ Delirium Hoppy Loft. More than a few years old. Pours oily black with little visible carbonation. Nose is interesting, heavily umami, soy sauce, light mocha, fish sauce, light almost vinous but not quite notes, very oily. Taste is heavy umami, roasted, soy sauce, fish sauce, mocha, near flat, oily, licorice herbs, light herbal coffee, touch dark fruits. Body is oily pretty much flat fish sauce. Not something that usually appeals to me but I did find this one quite interesting & enjoyable. Neat.
Black body with tan high head. Aroma is toffee, caramel, light coffee. Taste has high dark chocolate sweetness, caramel background. Cocoa. Body is heavy, medium carbonation.
Tap at Erzbierschof Zurich. Very sweet with lots of chocolate and coffee. Dense and heavy. Not overly complex, but very, very tasty!
Bottle at a tasting. Quite boozy, dried fruits, raisins. Rather sweet, simple, lacks a bit of complexity. Otherwise really good.

750 ml bottle shared by MisoW at Bratislava Tasting, thanks!
Almost black body, with a quite small, creamy, coffee colored head.
Aroma of chocolate, vanilla, cocoa, some coffee, some liquorice, slight dark fruits.
Tastes of dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, liquorice, tobacco, caramel, dark and dried fruits.
Medium, creamy mouthfeel, with an average carbonation.
Finishes roasty, medium dry, with dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, liquorice, tobacco.

Very tasty. Pleasantly dry, with loads of roasty, smooth dark malts. Propably the best Baltic Porter Ive had so far.

0,75l bottle shared by MisoW at Bratislava RB Tasting. Black color, small coffee-colored head. smells vanilla, wood, herbs, nettle, licorice, coffee. Good stuff, too much vanilla & licorice. Full body, slick mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Tastes of licorice, light wood, nettle, light vanilla, grapes, alcohol. Finishes with alcohol, nettle and licorice. Good beer, unfortunately I dont like vanilla & licorice in my beer. So not a favorite of mine.

Ruby dark brown, almost black colour with dark cream coffee foam. Smells strongly dried fruits like grapes and mullberry, coffee, vanilla, licourise, slightly roasted grains, woods. Tastes sweeter than it smells, coffee and licourise taste is dominant.
Bottle. Dark brown colour, beige head. Aroma caramel, mollasses, plums, dried fruits, licorice. Taste is roasted, caramel, plums, mollasses, bit sweet. Roasty aftertaste. Very good.

Bottle from my Secret Santa, robinvboyer, many thanks. Bottle at Joined Slovak&Austian ratebeer session 10/2015. Pours dark brown color, beige head. Aroma of coffee, dark chocolate, plums, licorice, vanilla, raisins. Taste is sweet, choco, coffee, plums, raisins, vanilla, wood, nuts. Really nice bittersweet chocolate finish with some warming alcohol.
Bottle at tasting, Gurthnars place. Very dark brown color with small beige head. Coffee, dark chocolate, vanilla, coconuts in aroma. Taste, roasted malt, coffee, cocoa, vanilla, wood. Tasty.

75cl bottle, shared with friends. Served in tulip. Pours black with nice tan head. Aroma is roasted malts, yeast and hints of chocolate. Taste is mostly licorice and dark fruits, all backed up by chocolate notes, yeast, and some smoke. The palate is sweet with some toastiness. Creamy mouthfeel, good carbonation. Well done.

Almost pitch black with a medium beige head. The head vanishes quite quickly. The aroma is deep chocolate and toffee with dark fruits. Flavor does even further with strong dark fruits and well balanced smoke. Its truly delicious although after drinking the whole bottle it became cloying sweet. No biggie at all. Its one of the best Baltic Porters I had. Great beer.

From bottle into wine glass. Black with carbonation, large brown head. Molasses, chocolate, yeast, marzipan, tea. Medium to heavy body,medium carbonation, slight bitterness with dry finish. Well rounded beer.

Bottle. Black, quick fading tan top. Sweet dark soft roasty, some milkyness, sweet licorice on nose. Full bodied, but real easy, creamy smooth texture. Licorice, sweet roast, chocolate. Really nice, dangeroud smooth easily drunk. Super passive but really flavourful. Should say a sipper, but its just so easy, palatable that a pint would go easy.-- bb

Pours a deep black topped by about a finger of rough creamy tanned head showing very good retention and lacing properties. The nose is cherries, dark chocolate, touch of smoke and earthy hops. The taste kicks off with the smoke and chocolate, but as you drink, it ends up shifting to a very sweet cherry. The brew is liquorish and very satisfying. It offers a long sweet and earthy finish I found really enjoyable. Insane beer for the cellar. Cheers!

Bottle to tulip
Loads of caramel, loads of malt, some light pepperiness. Dark, reddish brown with a thin, light tan head. Taste is light sourness, lots of caramel, and roasted malt.

Bottle from the LCBO. Black pour with burgundy highlights under a small khaki head that fades quickly. Nose is dark fruit, chocolate malts, vanilla, coffee and molasses along with a hint of smoke. Medium sweet start with an accompanying bitterness and more evidence of smoke. Medium sticky mouth with soft carbonation. Sweeter than I expected but with a smokiness and some bitter and tart components to keep it balanced. A nice leisurely sipper.

Such a complex and delicious Porter!
By far the best I had tasted!
A must to try!

From 750ml, 4oz sample, at BJCP meeting

Aroma: Very rich malty, slightly nutty and toasty with some prunes/chocolate/cherries

Appearance: Dark brown, very clear, thin light tan colored head

Taste: very smooth, noticeable alcohol warmth but not harsh, medium to low bitterness and hop flavor, slight licorice in finish.

Palate: full body and smooth, alcohol warmth, medium carbonation.

Overall: A very good Baltic Porter with hints of dark fruit flavors.
750ml bottle pours a dark brown color with a bit of head. Lots of caramel flavor, medium sweetness. Some noticeable alcohol.

Quelques reflets brunâtres discrets scintillent au travers une robe noire sur laquelle se forme une mousse plutôt mince. Le bouquet est principalement chocolaté, mais des traces de fruits secs tels que dattes, raisins et figues chatouillent également le museau. La rondeur des malts torréfiés et chocolatés est impeccable en bouche. Mélasse et réglisse se joignent à des saveurs chocolatées très agréables. Le taux dalcool élevé ny paraît pas tant, ne serait-ce quun apport chaleureux et réconfortant.

Bottle at le sur mesure in Nantes. Pitch black color with a nice but disappearing white head. Complex aroma, old fruit, coffee, chocolate... Full body and medium to light carbonation. Very long mouthfeel, not very bitter and not too much on the alcohol. Very well balanced. Nice

Black color beer with a small brown head that goes away immediately. Aroma is chocolate, vanilla, roasted malt and light fruit. Flavor is sweet, malty and with liquorice notes. Alcohol is evident but the beer is pretty balanced. Very thick body and long sticky and sweet end.
Ölföreningen 2015. Smak och doft av torkad frukt, choklad, portvin, vanilj och russin. Stor sötma, välbalanserad, rund och len, fin beska. Gott!
On tap at BlackLab, Barcelona. Pours black with brown head. Aroma of chocolate, alcohol, fruity sweet. Dark dried fruits (raisins). Nice dessert beer.

Pitch black with light brown foam. The smell is the one of a lager with chocolate that has been open for too long. The taste is way better. Diabetes comes for free on the first sip, but at least you are not aware of how much you are torturing your liver. Chocolate and very little coffee as well. Dangerously easy to drink.

Bottle. Pours jet black with a lasting tan head and had some mild lacing. Aroma was rich and intense with chocolate, caramel, coffee, vanilla, roasted malts and dark fruit. Flavor was rather sweet and complex with caramel, roasted coffee, chocolate, roasted malts, cherries, dark fruit and brown sugar. sticky texture, medium full body, low carbonation. awesome baltic porter

Flaska från Saveur-bier. En stor och riktigt söt porter med mycket söt torkad frukt, russin, choklad och mycket mört söt malt. Mjuk rund utan kanter, beska eller kärvhet. Kanske Imperial Schwarzbier beskriver smakupplevelsen bäst. Lite väl sött men annars riktigt gott.

Bottled. Very dark brown with some sledge. Very sweet malty aroma of dried fruits and dessert wines. Taste is similar - dominated by maltiness with dried plums reisin. Some alcohol is here medium high to full body. Overll excellent baltic porter.

Arômes de café, sucre, anis, pelures de pomnes. En bouche, goût prononcé de cassonade et de café latté froid. Des notes de bois brulé, chocolat et de mélasse se font sentir. La finale est brève, les saveurs de café au lait collent au palais. Le corps est bien rond, crémeux, doux et sucré. Le taux dalcool bien caché.

UPDATED: DEC 23, 2015 I said to my lovely girlfriend "Ummmm...my god....come be a part of this beer". She came in, sniffed curiously, took a sip and after a few deliciously girly coos and cahs said "I think that is my favourite beer I have ever had". And that folks, is the way she goes. I could go on about how it looks but Id rather make it clear that I now feel like a dumb-dumb for having only got two bottles, one for now and one to cellar. The flavour is so damned wonderful that I dont even feel like writing about all of the nuance about it. If you like fine, strong, scrumptious, roasty, dark beers and you are financially solvent and have access to an area that hovers around 10 degrees Celsius, do yourself a solid. Buy a case or two. 


Cellard Rating 12/23/2015- About nine months later. Still just as fine as I remembered it was, maybe even better. There is only the slightest tinge of alcohol in this heavyweight. Its remarkably smooth and dangerously drinkable; curiously complex, a licorice, chocolate and rich, smooth espresso dominate the delivery to the senses. I dont believe to much changes, perhaps just a more seamless integration of tastes and a lessening of alcoholic burn. For those curious, this was stored in a root cellar that mostly hovers around 50-55F but sometimes sees 60-65F during Summer.

This is my perfect beer. Pours inky-black with a thin brown lace. Excellent mouthfeel and a medium-heavy body but without any syrupy consistency. Tastes of chocolate, cherries, brandy, almonds, sherry, molasses and strawberries, with a sweet though not cloying aftertaste. Well-balanced sweetness that doesnt feel sugary or overpowering. Good medium-light fizziness, not overcarbonated, and a smooth mouthfeel. 

Fantastic beer, one of the best porters in the world!

Pour is jet black with a reddish cap that sticks around for a bit and leaves some light lace. Nose is chocolate, dark cherries, molasses, vanilla, caramel, light coffee, wood and smoke. Taste is unabashedly sweet, yet somehow not heavy, and not at all cloying. Its all chocolate and cherries and molasses, with a perfect balance of roasted malt bitterness on the finish. Alcohol is there for a bit of warmth, but otherwise so well-masked. Texture is pure velvet. Its definitely intense, definitely a slow sipper, but it goes down so damn smooth. Epic stuff.
Basically perfect, rich velvety palate, fruity, chocolatey, a touch of coffee. Complex beer that really evokes "baltic porter" rather than just "imperial stout with a different name."

Bottle @ home from HappyHoppy - Color: dark opaque black beer with small carbonation and small brown head. Smell: very intensive malt and ester smell it notes of roasted malt and vanilla. Black cherry balanced. Taste: very complex beer with good presence of mouth. Notes of malt and vanilla balance, notes of barrel. Aftertaste: strong malt wish with vanilla. Really amazing beer!

UPDATED: OCT 11, 2015 Update: fresh bottle this time. Better than aged. 750ml 2010 bottle shared with friends. Aroma: lots of chocolate, coffee, vanilla, dark red fruits, candied fruits but not too present, licorice, woody. App: dark brown, brown frothy head, awesome lacing. Taste and palate: full body, smooth, medium sweetness, light bitter finish. Overall: much better newer than my first rating where it was aged for 5 years. Less licorice. 

Old review: Thanks Jo. Aroma: caramel, vanilla, dark red fruits. App: dark reddish, no head. Taste and palate: licorice, medium sweetness.Overall: aged really well. So licorice. No maderidation
Draft - Deep dark chocolate. Jet black with a nice brown head. Molasses and sweet with a nice finish.

2011 Vintage. 750ml bottle. Sweet Jesus, this lives up to the hype! Pours black with a one finger mocha coloured head. Smells so damn good! Molasses, big chocolate and cocoa, caramel, light spearmint, butterscotch sauce, light Butter Rum Lifesavers, and some light dark coffee too. Taste wise, its sweet, medium bodied with caramel, molasses, alcohol, dates, raisin, and light amaretto that heads into some strong dark roast coffee notes, roasty malts, light ash, and a bitter finish that showcases more dark roast coffee. Ive never had this fresh out of the bottle, so I dont know if its the age that is helping it out, but this is flat out awesome. This beer makes the world a better place. Im sure of it! Drive to Quebec right now, and stock up.
Poured from the tap. Dark brown with dissipating light tan head. Tobacco, mild coffee, some chocolate and leather, sweet molasses. Excellent beer.

2014 bottle. Pours a near black/caramel with a thin, khaki head. Aroma has nice, sweet notes of roast with some brown sugar, caramel, chocolate, and mild spices. Taste is sweet but balances. Medium roast with dark chocolate, caramel, brown sugar. Medium-full body with a low-medium carbonation. Smooth in the mouth with a silky texture. Overall very tasty. Caramel and roast with a smooth texture.

(Bottle, Stockholm Beer Festival, 26 Sep 2014) Dark brown colour with brief, beige head. Malty, fruity nose with dried fruit, raisins, brown sugar and coffee. Malty, fruity taste with notes of caramel, chocolate, coffee, spices, brown sugar and a generous spicy/roasty bitterness in the finish. Full body, with a certain sweetness. Quite complex and slightly fruity porter with lots of things going on. Still in good balance. Lovely beer!

750 mL bottle. Black pour, ruby tint, Lovely wet sand head, nice and dense with some good retention. Roast malt aroma, vanilla, caramel, chocolate, toffee. Taste is heavy on the roast, licorice, some earthiness too. Heavy body.
on tap @ Erzbierschof. Beautiful dark brown appearance with beige head. Sweet coffee notes, smooth mouthfeel. Great, but very sweet.

This is a great strong Porter. Its dark malty, silky smoothness is not overshadowed by the high alcohol content. The taste is chocolate, vanilla, coffee and a slight smoky malt. Theres a sweet sensation on the palate initially which fades to reveal the hops later. Great example.

On tap at the Knick. Rich malt, chocolate, coffee, molasses alcohol vapors. Sweet and musky, a great aroma. Heavy body with medium-light carbonation. Alcohol warming. Dark black opaque with very thin light tan head. Starts and stays sweet, rich with roasted barley, and chocolate. Sweet throughout. Big sweet finish with mild smooth and light bitterness. Sugary lingering after with warming.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2015 Nice dark color with mocha head. Aroma is a bit faint. Just some dark malts and faint coffee and cacao. Taste is very weird. Reminds of a German dunkel but not a very good one. Its just on the border between sweet and roasty but its not falling in any category. That doesnt mean its balanced, its just... weird. Body is also on the medium-thin side showing its lager characteristic. I cant say it was bad but I didnt really enjoy it.

Bottle at SBWF 2014. Opaque black liquid with a small to medium light tan head. Aroma of bread, pumpernickel, chocolate, licorice and light coffee. Taste is light to medium sweet and light bitter with notes of pumpernickel and dried fruit. Medium to full bodied with low to medium carbonation. Quite nice.
2011 bottle given to me by my awesome wife. Pours an opaque colour with a fast to dissipate head, lots of residual sugar spots, but no real lace. Aroma is vanilla sweetness. I like this.
Bottle. Pours a black color with a small tan head. Has a roasted malty chocolate aroma. Roasted malty grainy chocolate and caramel flavor. Has a roasted malty sweetish caramel and chocolate finish.

Bottle bought @ bierkompass.de. Pours blackish brown with a frothy mocha head that leaves some thick trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is sweet and malty with roasted malts, caramel, sweetened coffee, dark chocolate, butterscotch, moist soil, charred wood and toffee. (Bottle) Pours black with dark brown to black with a pale brown head. The aroma holds sweet dark bread up front with undertones of caramel, potatoes, liquorice and earth. The flavour is near medium sweet, light bitter and tiny acidic with notes of dark bread, dark syrup and earthy hops. The mouthfeel is clean and sticky with a soft carbonation. Medium to full carbonation. Quite bock-ish.

Sample at SBWF 2014. 

Black with a tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, some dark fruit, toffee and vanilla. Similar sweetish taste. Some warming alcohol in the finish. A nice desert beer.

10% bottle brought back from Canada shared at the Craft Beer Picnic. Pitch black pour with a creamy beige head. The nose is rich, umami, rich bready chocolate cake - very savoury. Med-full bodied with a lively sparkling carbonation. The taste is chocolatey, rich, you definitely get sweet syrupy chocolate smoke - wonderful. Honestly it wowed everyone who tasted it.

Sample at SBWF 2014. Black beer with a nice brownish head. Roasted chocolate aroma, figs, raisins, caramel, plums, vanilla, licorice, toffee, some vinous notes. Fruity caramel flavor, licorice, figs, dades, grapes, licorice, chocolate, cream, some raisins. On the sweet side, but delicious.

Deep shoe-brown to black with a reddish tinge and minimal head. Aroma of caramelised nuts, macerated cherry, milk chocokate, pregnant dark Doppelbock malts without too much of its abv breath. Tastevis quite the explosive surpise in perfect balance: rum cask, cocoa, leather-clad figs (the older dogs bollocks), dried yeast, demerera sugar. Thick, round, gorgeous mouthfeel: as good as bottom-fermenting without icebocking gets.

On tap at Apex. 

A: Dark black with a light cappuccino head. Legs.

N: Cocoa, coffee, vanilla, smoke, char, and big caramel. Black peppercorn and rye bread. 

T: Big sweetness and a huge smoke component to keep this from becoming cloying. 

M: Oily, medium-heavy body. Alcohol is well-hidden. 

O: This is incredibly rich and tasty. Huge flavor components, but theres enough balance to keep things interesting and lively. Highly recommended; definitely one of my favorite Baltic Porters yet.
Bouteille de 750ml de noire. Arome de vanille et café. Au gout sucré et goût de chocolat vanille et café si pris avec du chocolat. Très bonne!

Bottle shared with Dani and Dan at the Pig in Boca. Poured into a small snifter. Jet black pour with a tan lasting head. Some mild lacing. The aroma was roasted malts, brazil nuts, dark chocolate, vanilla, and coffee. The taste was fairly the same with the nice roastness hitting first and then the dark chocolate and bitter coffee finish. Also nuts, prunes, and vanilla. Medium to full body, creamy mouth. All around terrific. Slightly sweet.

Bottle @Mondial de la bière. Dark beer with medium off white head. Nose is intense on roasted notes, dark malt, dark chocolate. Aroma is very swwet on caramel, chocolate, plum , fig, creamy body, very nice and complex. Finish on fig and roasted notes, very nice.

Pours cola colour with small beige head. Aromas of milk chocolate, vanilla, toast and a hint of cherry - overall quite sweet but inviting. Taste is also very sweet - caramel, dried fruits, hint of roasted meat, praline. Not much bitterness but a little dryness in the finish. Closer to a quadrupel than a porter but a very good dessert beer regardless. Medium body works well, could be cloying if more viscous.
Smoke and roast malts dominate the aroma. No hops to speak of. Caramel, sweet and sticky. Leads into the finish as well.
bière légère mais qui a du style goût de chocolat et café texture agréable en bouche .

This is insanely good. Thanks Chad. Pours a deep brown with foamy mocha head. Aromas are intense dried fruit, bubblegum and cherries. Flavors are dried fruit, bubblegum, coffee and dark chocolate on the finish. This is really good. Very smooth and drinkable.
Bottle. Pour is deep brown with a small tan head. Aroma and flavor of rich coffee, dark fruit, roasted malt, cocoa powder, cherries, and booze. Sweet finish.
Black in color with a big thick tan head. Smells of licorice, a lot of coffee. Taste is of roastiness, alcohol, and licorice.

750 bottle. Black pour with small tan head. Mild aromas of chocolates and fruits. Sweet big flavors of chocolate cherries, along with brown sugars, fruits, roasted malts. Creamy and complex. Mild burn in finish. Good cold weather beer.

From bottle :  Pours dark as night with a big fluffy brown head. Aroma is wonderfully pleasant. Coffee malts and caramel, sweet roasty chocolate...very complex. The taste is light and sweet. The body is medium when going down, feels lively and creamy with a pleasant finish. Overall a very solid porter that was very much enjoyed.

Apparence: D?une couleur noire opaque, elle est coiffée d?une mousse moyenne d?une couleur caramel d?une durée moyenne. Effervescence difficile à évaluer, mais semble quasi inexistante.

Arômes: Au nez, ce sont des notes de chocolat et de malt torréfié.

Saveurs: En bouche, cest un corps léger. Au goût, cest des saveurs de chocolat et de café. De longueur moyenne, il ny a aucune effervescence et quune très faible amertume.

(Re-reviewed after a years cellaring)

Pours a deep cola brown with a short-lived tan head and no lacing. Nose is dark fruits, cherry, roast malt, chocolate, very slight smoke. Taste is sweet and only slightly slightly bitter, with caramel, coffee, roasted malt, and maybe just a hint of liquorice. Body is sticky and heavy, but not overly so, and is buoyed somewhat by the persistent carbonation that remains despite the low head.

A year in the cellar has not hurt this at all - just the opposite, in fact. The flavours that I felt were muddled before have now blended beautifully. This is deep, dark and rich, sweet without being too much so, with just the right edge and warming on the finish. I think Ill keep my last one in the cellar for another couple years, maybe pick up another couple to do a vertical. I was far too harsh on it with my last rating - or, alternatively, its improved loads - but either way, Im re-rating it significantly higher.

Bottle from RBC. Pours near black with brown head. Aroma is rich: chocolate, coffee, cola, cherry cordials, wine and roast. Taste: rather sweet, rich, chocolate with alcohol and cherries. Medium-full body, slick oily sticky texture. Overall: nice sweet dessert.
On tap at La fira del poblenou. Black colour with tan head. Chocolate, caramel, malt aroma. Sweet, chocolate, metallic, watery taste. Medium body.

750ml bottle. Darkest brown, quasi black colour with average, thick, frothy to creamy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, beige to tan head. Rich and intense dark malty aroma, notes of dark chocolate, roast, coffee, a roasty-herbal-spicy touch, even cautious hints of smoke. Taste is rather different: moderately sweet dark malty, chocolately, notes of dark cherries, cherry liquor, fruit in rum, a dry woody note and some bitter hop arrange for counterbalance; slightly warming, alcoholic finish. Full body, oily texture, sticky palate. Astonishing discrepancy between aroma and taste; I wouldnt mind to find more of those roasty and spicy flavours in taste.

750 ml bottle. Pours a deep black with wisp of head and light lacing. Aroma is dark fruits, cherry, roast, oak, slight cinnamon and chocolate. Flavor is big and bold, with slight coconut sweetness in addition to aroma notes. Delicious.
Bottle. Pours a dark brown with small beige head that lasts. The aroma is bready malt and plums. Medium mouthfeel with dark fruits, toast, with lingering dry finish. Good.
750-ml bottle from the-rare-beer-club. gave a number of beers a 5 recently. this one raised the bar. loved the smoke + dark fruit. and its a lager?

Pours very dark brown with a one finger off white head. Almost zero lacing left behind.
Aromas of dark chocolate, malts, and a promise of something a bit sweet.
On the palate it has chocolatey malts up front, but on the back end there is a strong suggestion of molasses and caramel, with a definite hint of honey-like sweetness on the swallow.
First beer for me from this brewery and these guys are doing it right.

Deep rich flavour and cherry finish make this delicious stout a delight to the palate.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750 ml bottle. Dark brown, almost black with small beige head. Aromas of roasted malt, coffee and chocolate. Flavour is sweet, slightly bitter with coffee, roasted malt, caramel and licorice. Medium body, oily texture and soft carbonation. Pretty good stuff.

Bouteille de 750 ml (édition 2011) achetée chez Bière, Etc. à Montréal au coût de $8.49. Dégustée le 30 septembre 2012 (pint). Bière noire opaque. Col beige crème foncé, moyen, crémeux et persistant. Odeur de chocolat noir très marquée, de café torréfié. Saveur de chocolat noir bien présente, avec une touche de cerises et de toffee en finale. Alcool présent mais pas gênant. Se boit bien, moins corsée quune stout impériale. Très typée chocolat/alcool.

Black pour with an orange hue and thin off white head ... aroma of coffee, vanilla, smoke and dark chocolate/roasted malts .... taste is sweet and bitter with some cherry smoked malts but mostly vanilla, dark chocolate and roasted malts  ..... abv is a little evident and it has a very nice bitter bite ..... full bodied brew and everything it was advertised

Bière de grands moments. Sombre avec reflet acajou. Jamais aggressive et jamais ennuyante. Le goût évolue avec le changement de température, et il y a tout ce que jadore dune bière: chocolat, fumée et caramel, ainsi que raisin sec pour ajouter à la complexité. Lalcool soutient le tout jusquau finale ... et on recommence!

Recht süßer Malzantrunk, der sich leider noch verstärkt. Im Mittelteil wirkt das ganze dann schon zuckrig, leicht Vanille und Kaffee. Der Alkohol ist in der Nase zu vernehmen, minimal herb im Hintergrund. Schokoladig, likörartig. Zu süß! 8/9/8/9/12/9

Black colour with a frothy and creamy off-white head with medium duration and nice lacework. Aroma is dominated by roasted and toasted malts, strngo coffee notes and black chocolate. Flavor has notes of coffee beans, roasted malts, some ashes, licorice hints and roasted malts. The final has a good presence of coffee notes witha medium bitterness. Creamy and dense on palate, easy to drink in spite of the high ABV.
Bottle split with Chris. Pours near black, small tan head, little lace. Aroma of roast, chocolate, cherry. Taste follows aroma. Big fruity esters, medium body, little bitterness.

On tap at apex. Pours almost black with faint brown edges, thin roping of off-white cap. Aroma of dark fruits, smoke, wood chips, molasses. Taste is sweet and bitter. Low carbonation, creamy, balanced finish of sticky dryness.
A good beer to enjoy after a nice day on the slopes. Warms you up inside and makes you feel like man.

Pours a pitch black, with a billowy mocha head. The aroma has rich malt notes of coffee, espresso, and nuts. Also notes of smoke, vanilla, liquorice, leathery and spice. Upon tasting, I am blasted with a rich sweet sticky malts with notes of sweet chocolate, esters, woody tannins, spice, and lingering liquorice notes. The palate is slick and resinous, with a delicious linger of sweet tang. This is a spectacular Baltic, quite simply a masterpiece!!

750ml Flasche.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein sehr dunkebraunes fast schwarzes Bier mit geringer aber schönen bräunlichen Schaumkrone. Geruch intensiv röstmalzig, fruchtig bitter. Geschmack sehr fruchtig röstmalzig, Kaffee, Schokolade, im Hintergrund sehr angenehme Aromen von exotischen Früchten.
Bottle I brought to the Triad bottle share at Foothills organized by Mike. Nice boozy sweetness to go with dark chocolate and caramel notes. Slight graininess in the finish. Pretty nice.

Bottle @ Dean to Mouth tasting, courtesy of worldbeertaste. Pours a pitch black beer with a small off white head on top. Aroma has oak, licorice and is fairly boozy with hints of mostly caramel and molasses. Dark red fruits also present. Flavor has a lot sweet, woody touches, light smoke and loads of chocolate. Long, sticky sweet aftertaste. Very nicely done by these brewers!
[2012] 750ml bottle. Deep brown with a thin tan head. Flavors are coffee, chocolate, caramel, vanilla, molasses, dark fruits, licorice and smoke. Medium body, moderate carbonation, creamy texture.

Sampled from bottle @ The Hague Tasting. Dark brownish mahogany red color, medium sized tan head. Smell and taste malts, sweetness, caramel, slightly candy and overripe and dark fruits. Medium body and carbonation.

Bottle at the "Lets celebrate the fact that Dean is already the Mayor of M&S Den Haag even though its only been open for 24 hours tasting!". Poured a dark mahogany colour with a frothy light tan head. The aroma is malt creamy caramel light fruit. The flavour is medium bitter moderate sweet with a creamy caramel fruity palate. Full bodied with soft carbonation.
Poured deep dark brown with a beige froth. Aroma of roast malt, bitter chocolate and roast malt. Full body, flavour as the aroma, vinous berries.

Bottle shared at the "Lets celebrate the fact that Dean is already the Mayor of M&S Den Haag even though its only been open for 24 hours tasting!". Pours near black with a small tan head. Aroma of big roast, raisins, dark fruits, caramel, malt. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and light bitter. Some coffee coming out in the palate. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Deep dark brown with a tan, bubbly, lacy lasting head. Smells of sour liquorish, blackberry, and dark malt. Medium to full oily body. Tastes of sweet malt, nice soft roast well rounded balanced bitterness to sweetness. Liquorish, blackberry and raisin. Nice excellent brew.

sample @THT courtesy of Worldbeertaste.
thin tan head. Clear deep burgundy pour. A very nice baltic porter
Bottle. Pours dark brown. Aroma is big chocolate and caramel, some caliphs, light roast and candy sweetness. Very sweet and not much bitterness. Ok but too sweet for me.

Botella de 75 en el lúpulo. En el momento 12_02-2014
Cuerpo fuerte con sensación alcohólica bastante acentuada con 10 vol bastante notables. 
Aromas especiados algo tostados y dulces ahumados. 
Sabores tostados y dulces bastante intensos intensificándose cada vez mas según va calentando. Especias, vainilla, bastante apreciable también. Ligeros toques quemados. Bastante buena con un cuerpo intenso, suave y sedoso que se bebe bien. Para repetir sin duda. Gran cerveza canadiense.

February 7, 2014. 750mL bottle from LCBO. My favourite baltic porter, and my favourite beer from this brewer. Dark chocolate and cherries in nose. Small tan head. Skily mouthfeel. Dark chocolate and sweet ripe fruits in flavour, with a hint of coffee. Quite lovely.

God thats a good beer. Its like having a great moment, youll think twice before you give a pint of this to a friend. Ask yourself if its a good friend, is he worth it? 10% alcohol but you wont realize before you stand up (no taste of alcohol at all). And Id say creamy. I dont give it a 5/5 only cause I want to save room for others ratings to come!

Easily one of the best baltics I've had. Beautiful in taste. The best part truly I think is the slight cherry infusion throughout. Sublime. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Frisco Tap House & Brewery in Columbia, MD. 

Opaque, black-brown with a tan head and good lacing. 

Aroma of raisins, plums, cherries, molasses, vanilla, roasted malt and chocolate. 

Taste of molasses, vanilla, chocolate, dark fruit, caramel, toffee, brown sugar and charcoal. Sweet and wonderfully delicious. 

Full body and low carbonization.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark brown-black body, medium sized tan head, soapy lacing. Rich roasted coffee dominates. Complimented by chocolate, other roasted malts and dark fruits. Medium to full bodied, moderate carbonation, earthy bitter finish.
Trop bonne avec la bûche de Noël au chocolat et fruit de la passion!!! Pas trop lourde, juste bien dosée. Excellent produit ;)
bottle. Dark black colour, small bubbly head. Smoky vanilla and coffee dominate. Some light sweet berry, cake/bread flavours too. Easy to drink for the ABV. Very good!

Color caoba oscuro, reflejos rubí y espuma beige . Aromas de frutas confitadas, tostados, café y ligero licor. En boca es ligera con un inicio dulce y afrutado que muestra una lgierisima acidez muy agradable a lo que sigue un amargor equilibrado y tostado que permanece hsata el regusto. Excelente.

Rating #787 - Nov 27, 2013 - 8 oz on tap at Beer Revolution. Black as a Northern Quebecois winter night with a weak bubbly tan foam. Aroma is heavy roast malt,lots of coffee, chocolate, and choke cherries. Taste is mild bitterness, medium-heavy alcohol character, lots of black forest cake, chocolate cherry flavours and smokiness on the palate in the finish. Really cool porter, which easily stands up with some of the bigger Imperial Stouts. Crazy Delicious.

Bière de couleur noire avec des reflet intense brun et un beau col mousseux beige qui se dissipe assez rapidement. Nez de malt grillée de chocolat et café complexe. En bouche malt grillé,chocolat,café,caramel cest très sec contrairement a une Stout mais cest très complexe et cest délicieux. Ça se boit tranquillement mais cest une excellente bière ce nest pas un style quon voit souvent!

Botella. Presencia marrón muy oscura sin corona. Aroma licoroso, frutos secos, madera, y algo de café. En boca muy sutil madera, pasas,alcohol, licor-café, con un final largo alcohólico y cafetoso con grandes rasgos de Oporto
bottle. very nice porter, medium to fuller bodied black pour. very roast, chocolate & coffee notes, light vanilla undertones, light smoked malts. very nice

750mL Bottle, purchased at Ferme Guyon - Chambly, QC. Aroma of plums and lightly toasted malt. At 9 months old, Im really surprised by how intensely oxidized the hops are, perhaps its been kept very warm at times. The caramel notes are good, if a little heavy on caramel malt. Great dark fruits, ruby qualities, and lightly toasted malt. The alcohol is impressively integrated. Warm, clean, and dark, but lacking pilsner malt depth, with a little too much caramel malt range focus.

Aroma: Roasty cherry malt aroma

Taste:full body flavor, warm liquor finish yet smooth fruity aftertaste

Appearance:thin head with somewhat little retention2

WOW! This beer flirted to be my first perfect score. Dark brown, almost black pour with small tan head. Aroma of chocolate, caramel, coffee, vanilla, ripe fruit and faint smoked malts. Taste is frigging amazing, milk chocolate, caramel, vanilla, coffee, black cherry, smoky malts, amaretto and faint notes of peat and a touch of hop bitterness. Perfect carbonation, everthing comes together perfectly, creamy mouthfell, full bodied, absolutely decadent creamy chocolate finish that lasts forever. Brilliant beer, Bravo!!

11/X/13 - 75cl bottle @ home - BB: n/a, bottled: III/2013 (2013-950) Thanks to Sebletitje for sharing the bottle!
Clear dark brown to black beer, creamy beige head, little stable, non adhesive. Aroma: lots of coffee, mocha, dried fruits, chocolate, cherry jam, bit of chloride. MF: ok carbon, medium to full body. Taste: sweet start, mocha, dark caramel, coffee, liquorice, bit earthy. Aftertaste: mocha, coffee, sweet, plums and other dried fruits, little bitter, some overripe banana.

Pours cola dark with a frothy finger cap that holds on longer than a crack smoking mayor holds onto power. Aroma is rich malt & muted chocolate. Flavour is too much for me: the sweetness is soda syrup minus the carbonation. Starts off cherry cola on the tongue, shifts to dried dark figs in the middle, & finishes with a champagne like spark at the end. Adventurous brew. Thats some sweet beer, Monsieur.

This is quite a fantastic porter. Er... Lager (according to the label). Black as night with a light brown head, it looks nothing like a Shwarzbier or lager as stated on the label. It looks like a black porter. What the heck is this? Its nose is rich and roasted with notes of chocolate, maybe a little anise or vanilla, with charred, roasted malts in control. As roasted as this is, its incredibly smooth. Lots of sweet, yummy flavors reward you in the mouth, complex, smooth, and rich. Full bodied, but refreshing, this is perfect for an early autumn afternoon. A slight roasted malt bitterness carries through into the finish, ending slightly dry and almost fruity like a white wine somehow. Very well done!

750 mL bottle. Pours a deep red tinged black with a thick cappuccino colored head. Aromas of deeply roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, black cherry, and a hint of smoke. Clean and subtly sweet with a nice bitter herbal hop finish. Palate coating and above average carbonation, moderate body and a long layered finish. Very tasty, strongly preferred this to their Doppelbock that was also available in Ontario recently.

Really nice roasty, bitter, sweet and coffee notes in the nose. Smells very complex. Very dark, somewhat long lasting brown head. Upfront on the taste a mixture of sweetness and roasted malt, finishes with a molasses sweetness and a bit of a metallic note. Throughout some earthy hops with a bit of a bitter finish. Well balanced, a bit sweet for me. Somewhat thin and average carbonation. A great baltic porter for what it is.

UPDATED: SEP 19, 2016 Bière noire comme la nuit, aucune lumière ne peut la traverser, effervescence difficile à observer mais qui semble bonne, et surmontée dun col brun, pas tellement large, mais dense, mousseux et bien résistant. Arômes dominants de torréfaction (café, chocolat noir et grains brûlés), avec aussi légère fumée, tourbe et levure typique de bière noire (cuir, terre). On décèle également des effluves un peu plus fruités (prunes, cerises noires), ainsi que des pointes dalcool et de vanille. Nez très agréable, complexité et intensité élevées. En bouche, pétillement faible sur la langue, mais le breuvage est dune onctuosité et dune rondeur exceptionnelle au palais, très moelleux, très velouté! Au goût, cest absolument délicieux! Malt torréfié (café et riche chocolat noir!), fumée et fruité beaucoup plus présents quau nez (très agréable saveurs de prune, raisin, et cerise noire, avec même de la framboise, et plus). On retrouve également en bouche la vanille, ainsi quune bonne dose de sucres foncés (caramel, érable, mélasse). Le sucré est dominant dans cette bière, mais sans aucune exagération, et la finale se montre légèrement amère (sans goût houblonné particulier) et alcoolisée. Toutes ces saveurs sont incroyablement bien intégrées les unes aux autres! Complexité et intensité parfaites! Un gros coup de cur pour moi! /// Jai laissé vieillir une bouteille en cellier pendant trois ans et demi, et je lai ensuite dégustée comparativement à une bouteille fraîche. La bière vieillie ma semblé plus douce et plus harmonieuse, saveurs maltées plus franches (chocolat, sucres, fruits foncés), davantage de vanille, légère oxydation qui sharmonise bien au tout Mais ce nest pas si évident Je dirais que le vieillissement apporte une légère bonification, mais sans plus

Bouteille 75cl, bottled on 03/2013.
Brune foncée, col moyen café au lait.
Arôme malté grillé, note torréfiée-café ponctuée dun bouquet subtile de fruits noirs.
Palais offre une belle profondeur maltée, fruité noir rappelant les cerises et dates. Sucre brun résiduel sur un léger caramel - mélasse. Amertume nest pas en reste avec un ajout amérisant et fruité. Garde une levure rappelant un côté belge. Bière a partagée et qui devient vite épaisse et rattrapée par ses 10%.
this is quite strong but you would never know it to drink Cherry flavors with a touch of coffee and delicious flavors recommended to all
Great tasting beer that I would definitely recommend to a friend. I enjoy the taste and will get it again.

2011 bottle. Black pour with a small tan head. Aromas of dark fruit, chocolate, and molasses. Flavor is rich malt with coffee notes. Molasses comes out in the finish. Very sweet and complex. Delicious.

This poured a darker brown with a beige head. Smoke chocolate and medium roast in the aroma. Smoke leads the tastes, followed by roast, dark chocolate, and some dried dark fruit. Very intriguing stuff.

Bouteille de 750 ml, 8,99$ chez IGA. Couleur noire foncée avec reflet rougeâtre. Belle mousse presque brune mais qui disparaît rapidement, dépêchez-vous pour en prendre un petite gorgée! Odeur de fruits confits, sucre, caramel, malt torréfié, vanille. Goût très sucré, fruits confits, porto, malt torréfié. Palais trèes doux, peu deffervescence. Petit goût de café en fin de bouche. Hormis ce petit goût de café tardif, on pourrait croire que cest une Strong Ale. Elle est beaucoup trop sucrée pour dire quelle est une incontournable mais cest malgré tout un très bon produit!

Tried at cellar temperature in a little Belgian glass. First impression is strongly smoked cherries. Second impression is coffee, very dark roasted coffee beans, then taking one and chewing it. Almost getting a cherry Coke impression as well. Colour is black as sin, with a mild tan head that left a ring and a little lace. Taste has some sweetness on the lips and some bitterness at the back of the throat. Also a little dry, but loads of warming alcohol. Really quite a fantastic beer!

75 cl bottle @ RIP Camp.
Pours dark brown color with a red tint and minimal head. Aroma of toasted malts, dark chocolate, cocoa, some bilberries and smoky wood. Flavor of sweet caramel malts, dark berries, some roasted notes, dark fruits, toffee and vanilla. Quite smooth palate, no carbonation left on this one, leaked a bit, sweet and sticky caramel finish. Also, some vinous feel to it. Decent but a bit too sweet.
5314

750 ml bottle @ RIP camp.
Pours a black colour with a small faint head. Aroma of roasted malts, chocolate, licorice and some subtle sweet dried fruits. Flavour is rather sweet with notes of roasted malts, biscuit, cherries, vanilla beans, raisins, plums, mild bitterness, Very subtle smoked notes as well. Full bodied, oily mouthfeel and a bit low carbonation. Very vinous, dessert-like and elegant.

75 cl bottle @ RIP camp, produced 03/2013
Aroma has cocoa, some salty licorice and hints of soy sauce. Flavour is sweet with salty licorice, soy sauce and some roasted notes. Too sweet and malty. This one has some elements from foreign stouts.

The cork had a leak months before enjoying but the contents seem to be OK.

750ml bottle @ RIP Camp

Pours pitch black with a tiny head. Aroma of roasty malts, dark chocolate, coffee, hints of ripe fruits and smoke. Taste is smooth, sweet and syrupy with notes of roasty dark chocolate and ash. Finish is sweet, sticky and syrupy with notes of roastiness, dark chocolate and smoke. A bit too sweet for my taste.

750 ml bottle shared by Rastacouere at RBSG 2010 (notes). Pours a very dark brown color with a small to medium creamy beige head. The aroma and flavor had roasted malts edging on slightly burnt bread, chocolate, dark fruits that favor cherry, light smoke character and a splash of coffee. I had been wanting to try this and David came through.

For the Anglophones:"Black as a starless winter night, with a lovely glistening brown head, just perfect, looking oily and unctuous as a Baltic Porter should be. The aromas are chocolates, berries, vanila, leather and olives, although not too pungent on the last two. Tremendous flavours of dark chocolates, a drop of expresso, dates, prunes, figs and vegemite, oats, wood and smoke to warm up in winter nights, a bite of Tim hortons chili and a bit of smoked kujira blubber - and yes, I confess I have tried this beauty too. The palate is as the same as the look, with a lovely oily stick to it. Wonderful beer, with the only fault being the excessive rate of alcohol - totally unnecessary. 
And now the same version for the Francophones: "Magnifique! Je fuckin aime ça!"

The nose is fruit forward. Prunes, cheeries. Pours a meaty dark brown with no head or lacing. The flavor is primarily a soft roasty sweetness. Roasted malts, caramel, dark fruit, and notes of cherries with some alcohol warmth in the finish. Full body and smooth carbonation. A pleasing smooth mouthfeel. Overall, rich in flavor and texture. A very enjoyable Baltic porter. All for one and one for all!
UPDATED: OCT 4, 2013 sweeter than I expected, but a nice balance of charcoal at the back. Flavours of vanilla, cola, treacle some unusual texture in there...oily. Great brew

Bottled sample via brewedge, shared with oak bluff. Near black in colour with moderate carbonation. Aromas are of chocolate cake batter, vanilla extract, and cherry pits. More of that cake batter thing going on in the mouth along with booze, earthy roasted malts, more vanilla, and stone fruit. A bit sticky on the palate, but solid overall.
75 cl bottle, Mulmur, ON, Canada. Jet black, aroma of raisin, sweet molasses and resin. Smooth, not overly alcoholic, more prune sweetness with some chocolate and roasted coffee on the finish.

Bottle. Pours black with a thick light brown head that settles out to a quarter inch but leaves little lacing. aroma is caramel, chocolate and dough. Taste is fairly sweet with a full body, creamy texture and average carbonation. Superb!

750 ml bottle to oversized snifter (shared with the Mrs.; thanks DuffMan). Looks good; a fairly opaque dark cola with foamy beige head. Smells and tastes of dark malt, dark chocolate, cherry, and roast with a nice mouthfeel. Good stuff!

Porter Baltique des Trois Mousquetaires. Cest du café corsé, cest du chocolat, cest du bonbon sucré, cest de la réglisse, cest de la soie. Le fort taux dalcool se laisse oublier au gré des saveurs et on se rend compte quune bouteille de 750 ml, cest loin dêtre trop

Les Trois Mousquetaires, version 2012. En fût à L'Autre Oeil, 10%. Noir, mousse moka, fumée, fruit noir, caramel, grillé, brûlé, chocolat noir, chaleur d'alcool, onctueuse, bonne amertume, très sucré. Dangereux

Bottle 750ml. [2012]
Pours black (dark brown) with medium brown head. Aroma is of sugar, caramel, alcohol, roasted malt, smoke. Taste is of sweetness, caramel, roasted malt, vanilla. Palate: Full bodied, sticky. Overall: Very sweet. Pretty good. A sipper, somewhat cloying.

750ml bottle, 2012 vintage.  Served at cellar temperature.  Been looking for this guy for quite a while and very excited to try it out.

Pours very dark brown to black with a one finger foamy brown head that settles to a nice creamy cap and leaves some short-lived lacing behind.

Aroma is overripe dark fruits, a little acidic, some oxidation, some chocolate.  Good but not great strength.

The flavor is mighty impressive.  Big time rich chocolate and in-your-face dark fruits, dates, figs, raisins, tart cherries.  Rather sweet.  Minimal bitterness.  Some alcohol on the finish but not bad for 10%.

Mouthfeel is medium-plus, nearly full bodied, good carbonation, a little sticky.

Excellent Baltic Porter.  While the aroma is only OK, the flavor is fantastic.  Very rich and complex.

It pours deep mahogany almost black (it is opaque); the head is tan and mousse-like. The aroma has notes of: sour-cherries, charcoal, prunes, wood-smoke, brett, and chocolate. The taste is medium sweet that finishes medium sour and light dry; there are notes of: the aforementioned aroma notes, and very distinctive brett notes (that really accentuate the taste). The palate is full bodied, moderately viscous, slightly stick, low carbonation, and a long finish. Overall, simply amazing - and the accidental brett created some amazing flavours.

Vous navez pas le droit de dire que vous naimez pas les porters ou les bières foncées avant davoir goûté au Porter Baltique des Trois Mousquetaires. Cest du café corsé, cest du chocolat, cest du bonbon sucré, cest de la réglisse, cest de la soie. Le fort taux dalcool se laisse oublier au gré des saveurs et on se rend compte quune bouteille de 750 ml, cest loin dêtre trop.

750 ML bottle

Jet black color, two finger head that falls to a thick collar. No lacing but good ABV legs. 
Coffee, wood, chocolate, subtle notes of cherry, and earthy bitterness. Nice warming nose. 
Sweet tasting. Brown sugar, maple syrup, dark fruits, sweet chocolate. some coffee. Not as earthy as the nose leads to at all. Very smooth tasting with sweetness. 
Sweet and slick feel. Bitterness shows back up in the palate. Not very earthy as the sweetness really undercuts it. Still robust but more of a dessert beer. 
Nice,  but the sweetness is a bit much. Good nightcap

Bottle 750ml. corked @ [ (Easter "Flags of many nations" Tasting) by Chriso - London ].Clear dark brown colour with a small to average, frothy, good lacing, mostly diminishing, beige head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, chocolate, coffee, wood, alcohol. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a long duration, roasted, tart roasted, chocolate, port wine, cheery, sugary. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20130331]

750 ml bottle.  Pours a near opaque dark brown with a large mocha colored head.  Aromas are chalk, coffee, chocolate, ripe berries, and a bit of smoke.  Tastes are chocolate, coffee, sweet malts,  some smoke and alcohol.  Robust on the palate, moderate to heavy carbonation, slightly bitter finish.  Not bad but not well suited to my tastes.  Masks the 10% abv fairly well.

Aroma: Smelling of burnt bread, some ashes, dark dried fruits, sausages.Appearance: The beer is black with a light brown head, little lacing and rather small curtains.Taste: Intensely sweet start, candid sugar, toast, dates, figs, dark chocolate, a hint of cocoa beans.Palate: Little carbonation, oily and smooth, a huge body.Overall: Really a treat, "probably the best Baltic porter in the world".Note: Bottle 750 ml (thx to Kenneth Malmqvist, bought it in Montreal) Reviewed 2012-07-06.

Bottle from Kensington Wine Market, Calgary. It pours deep brown with a small off-white head. The nose is caramel, cola, cherryade, cocoa, wood and earth. The taste is pretty sweet actually....cola, roasted malt, sweet liquorice, tanginess, cherryade, umami aspect, brown sugar and chocolate. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Hides alcohol well. Not bad, just too sweet really.

Bottle at Chriso Easter "Flags of many nations" Tasting, 31/03/13 acquired through a trade in Montreal, March 12.
Extremely dark mahogony brown with a thin tan head.
Nose is light roast malt, sugars, lactose, dark toffee, dates, dark fruits.
Taste comprises roast malts, sweet brown sugars, dark chocolate, dark toffee.
Full bodied, fine carbonation, sweet finish,
Ok stuff but no world beater!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Beautiful looking - black with tan head. Looks like a stout! Smell is like sweet dark malt with a mild roasty character. Taste is cherry first. So rich. Lots of complexity. And the medium carbonation is perfect for the rich flavours. Palate is a bit clingy. Overall, a brilliant porter.

Bottle @ Bruces. Cheers to Paul for sourcing this bad boy. The pours deep brown with a tiny off-white head. The aromas of rich german chocolate cake, some cinnamon, stewed prune, Dr. Pepper. The taste is much the same. More sweet milk chocolate, prune. Plenty of red fruits, jam, butterscotch. The  finish is sickly sweet. Quite sugary. Medium body, fine carbonation. Overall, a bit too sweet, but decent.

Pours black with a tan head.
Nose shows roasted and bready malt, some nutty notes and a bit of cocoa.
Sweet flavours of chocolate liqueur, roasted malt, soft coffee, bready malt and booze. Too sweet.
Could use higher carbonation.

13th March 2013Bottle - thanks Paul! Almost clear dark brown beer, good pale tan head. Light palate, softish. Super mild tangy dark malts. Mellow chocolate, somewhere between dark and milk. Trace of coffee. Finishes quite sweet and tangy. Slightly left field but good.

Big-ass bottle (like a plus sized bomber) Pours an opaque, almost jet-black with a thin, espresso colored head that hung around for a while. Nose is all coffee, chocolate, dark roasted barley, dried fruit and malts. Mouth is oily and full-bodied, bittersweet and lightly smoky, with coffee, plums and dates up front, then some bakers chocolate, and a roasty and ever-so-slightly sooty bitter finish.  I dont know what Althos, Aramis & Porthos would say, but Im going with Je suis très impressionné!

Bottle shared at Bruces, London - many thanks to Paul. Pours clear, dark brown with a fine, beige cream head. Sugary dark malts in the nose, rich bread, some chocolate syrup. Huge sweet flavor, loads of sugary malts, brown sugar, brown bread, light smoke, more chocolate syrup. Full bodied with fine carbonation. Warm finish, pretty syrupy, some dark leaves, sweet bread, chocolate. Nice, if a bit sugary.

c est une excelente porter baltique a chaque annee le gout est toujours la.la 2012 a une complexiter de saveur de chocolat  avec un gout de fume et petit gout de cerise  finr avec une belle amertume c est une de mais preferer (rate59)

Une bonne Porter, mais pas extraordinaire.  Il manque le WOW! Je dois dire que les arômes et le look sont top, mais je ne suis pas satisfait du gout et le palais... parcontre, assé pour garder Les Trois Mousquetaires dans mon top 10 des Brasseries Québecoises.

I enjoyed this despite Ernestos hatred.  Quite smooth and lactose sweetness.  Milk chocolate and dark fruits with a touch of roast.  Very easy drinking with a very slight chemical sweetness that kept it from the 4s.

Refrigerated 75 cl brown bottle caged and corked poured into a snifter.  Pours black with light beige head.  A little lacing, thick body, low carbonation, and light balsamic.  Taste is roasted malt, some balsamic vinegar.

Poured from a 750 ml bottle. Pours a darker brown with a khaki colored head of foam. Aroma is chocolate and salty. Taste is sweet and a little salty with some chocolate and plum fruity notes. Interesting at least.
Got a lot of paint aroma and chemicals in the flavors and aroma. Thin and boozy and paint, sadly not a good combo

Odeur de metal mais heureusement le gout ne lest pas du tout. Le mouthfeel est tres soyeux voir de lait. Gout sucré et une certaine pesanteur du a lalcool. Une bonne biere mais je trouve que nest pas assez "drinkable"

750 ml. 10%. Peluso. Noire avec mousse beige. Odeur de malt torréfié. Gout très sucré de chocolat et café. Bière épaisse où le goût de l'alcool est bien dissimulé. Très peu d'amertume. Le gout se dissipe doucement, naturellement et laisse la bouche un peu collante.
Excellente bière.

Bottle. Black with a fizzy tan head. Aroma of cherry, citrus, chocolate and roasted grain. Full bodied sticky palate. Tastes of smokey, slightly burnt grain immediately followed by sweet candied orange and cherry flavors and finishing somewhat sour.

750ml bottle from 2011. Pours an inky black with a short brown head. Lovely dark chocolate notes in the aroma. Really vivid. Lots of cherry and dark fruit undercutting the chocolate and roast. The taste is rich with blackcurrant and liquorice, some remaining heat and plenty more cherries and chocolate. The addition of light BBQ flavours and wood smoke round things off nicely. Very nice slick and oily mouthfeel and a good mix of sweetness and bitterness. Reminded me of Stormaktsporter ever so slightly. A great beer overall and certainly ones of the best porters Ive had.

Draft from St. Augustines Vancouver. Pours a very dark brown, no head. Aroma is very subtle, hints of roasted malt. Body is thick and syrupy, finish is sweet, sugary, and long. Warming is well hidden. Overall pretty nice but I might want a little bit more maltiness in the finish.

2011 bottle. Pours black with a frothy beige head that fades to a perimeter. Aroma is of raisin, figs, leather, vanilla, smoke and caramel. Taste is dominated by an interesting balance between sweet and smoky malt. Body is thick and syrupy, but not really cloying. Very clean mouthfeel, none of the silt that can happen when the colour is this dark and the abv this high. There is a small amount of herbal hops in the finish, with some caramel and booze. Incredible beer overall, wishing I had more bottles to age.
UPDATED: JAN 20, 2013 On tap at St Augustines on The Drive. Wow! This black brew is like nothing so much as liquid chocolate cake, with a chaser of good strong coffee.

Bottle. 2011. Pours a brown color with a light tan head that quickly dissipates. The nose has notes of soy, dark fruit, and olive. Medium mouthfeel. Sweet caramel, leather, and coffee. Tastes better than it smells. Faint note of smoke as well.

Une grande porter, avec arômes de cerises, de caramel et de chocolat. La 2011 a bien bénéficié dun vieillissement qui la rend plus ronde, un peu plus complexe. La 2012 a un peu plus de mordant, les houblons sont un peu plus perceptibles. Sucrée et copieuse.

Holy molasses! My friend couldnt stand this; for me it was a revelation. Weve never disagreed so much on a beer. Very sweet, but not cloying. A bit of dark fruit but less than I was expecting, just smoky woody porterness. Awesome.
Draft. Dark brown color, small tan head. Aroma of figs, dates, raisines, chocolate. Taste is sweet and rich fruity chocolate. Tasty.

Hot damn. Draft at Churchkey in DC. Pours dark brown without much of any head. Nose of wood, mild smoke, some fruit and light cherry notes, and some cinnamon. Mild shag tobacco. Cocoa. Taste starts off sweet but ends with a nice bitterness. I repeat: hot damn.

75cl bottle at UDRBM, cuvée 2011. Black colour, brown head. Aroma is sweet, chocolate, molasses, pipe tobacco. Flavour is rather sweet, chocolate, light fruity, hard roasted malts, its very sweet but also very very tasty. Medium to full-bodied. Nice.

Dark brown, beige head. Rich smooth aroma, sticky dark fruits, dried figs, milk chocolate. Super nice. Smooth yet lively well made body. Starts with sticky fruit sweetness, then a dry plucky bitterness. Warming and tasteful. (UDRBM)
