Bottle at UDRBM. Black pour, huge tan head. Aroma of roasty malts, sweet caramel, chocolate, dark fruits and a hint of alcohol. Flavor is very sweet chocolate, caramel, some spices, a hint of port and some ash. Very nice brew, although on the sweet side. Well drinkable.
Bottle @ tasting. Aroma is silty liquorice, roasty malt and faint smoke. Flavour is sweet liquorice, roasty malt, silty smoky liquorice.

A solid pour into my Bruery tulip produces a dense, three-finger thick, nicely browned, dark tan colored head; it leaves some nice layered lacing on the sides of my glass. The beer is a dark, black color that shows an opaque black hue that shows a hint of a deep red glow when held up directly to the light. The beer smells quite smoky, followed by a warming, spicy alcohol note, a rounded roasted character, some dark chocolate character, a touch of chalky roast character, and even a burnt, smoky fruit character that almost leans towards cherry.

Lightly sweet up front, the beer has a lightness to it up  front, but quickly gets more chewy and rich through to the finish. The smokiness is quite a bit reduced in the flavor compared to it being the dominant note in the nose. Instead rich, dark chocolate, smooth roasted malt, molasses sweetened coffee, and roasted caramel notes are balanced by a soft smokiness that adds a savory roundness to the flavor. The carbonation is fairly light, but still provides a prickly texture to the finish. The sweetness accentuates a roasted, smoky cherry flavor in this beer. As the beer warms up it gets a touch more sweet. The smokiness has a touch of a sharp edge to it; a hint of burnt plastic, and a slight harshness that is characteristic of Briess Cherrywood smoked malt, though it is low enough that it doesnt ruin the beer.

Tasty and lighter bodied than I would have expected in a beer of this strength. This is the first use of cherrywood smoked malt that wasnt so harsh that it didnt just ruin the beer; I would still prefer a different type of woodsmoked malt, but this one was done well and is quite nice in the end.
Pours dark with minimal head. Aroma roasted coffee, malt, chocolate. Taste follows suit with aroma with a touch of smokiness. Medium body, light biterness, nice porter

Bottle shared by a friend. Darkest brown pour with a huge tan head. Aroma of malt, tart cherry, smoke and green olives. Malty flavor with tart cherry, chocolate, smoke and tobacco before a roasty finish. Flavor was decent, but I couldnt get around the nose.

750ml bottle. Dark brown motor oil, with some ruby around the edges, largish head, good lacing. Big chocolatey smell. Taste is chocolate syrup, almost a chocolate wine. Alcohol is present, but not overpowering or out of place. Body is quite sticky and thick. Overall, definitely a sipping beer and doling it out on those huge bottles is a little cruel, but very enjoyable. Pleasant and warming.

Appearance:  near black, with dark brown edges and a thick, creamy dark beige head and minimal lacing.   Aroma:  chocolate, coffee, condensed milk, bourbon, vanilla, cherries, and a bit of campfire.   Taste: chocolatey but not overly sweet, with additional notes of coffee, licorice, malted milk balls, cherries, wood, and smoke.   Finish: 	semisweet, with a bit of a lactic tang.   Notes: 	A bit like chocolate cherry pie.  The alcohol was extremely well-hidden.  I didnt love it, but I did like it.   Bottle from the Rare Beer Club.

750 ml. Bottled 1/ 7 /2011.Thanks to Adam Jackson. Tulip shows oblique black with a small ring of beige head. Nose is malt, alcohol and a hint of smoke.  Taste is much the same. Somewhat sweet from the malts with a mild alcohol taste. Kind of flat carbonation. I can not compare this to any other porter, its kind of its own thing. Nice

Bottle acquired in a trade. Poured at cellar temp into a wine glass. Light brown on the pour. dark brown to black in the glass. Very minimal head. Hint of campfire smell. Some dark fruits and cocoa on the nose. Taste more of the same but more smokiness than I would like. More dark fruits like cherries and raisins. Smooth roasted malt finish. almost no carbonation on the mouth feel.

Courtesy of Adams fridge. Many thanks! Pours a deeply imbedded charcoal brownish black with a trim, frothy khaki head. Smells of prune syrup, alcohol, raisins, beet juice, heavy-charred oak, and holiday spices. Tastes predominately of raisins, caramel, roast, lactose, lavender, milk chocolate, American hops and candle wax. Ends slightly sour with notes of butterscotch, soured milk and smoked wheat. I can drink this all night.

Bit of a metallic aroma on this one.  Pours jet black. It is really slick and viscous on the tongue.  Initially mostly sweet then a bit of coffee notes come in as the beer warms.  Interesting but missing something for me.
Molasses, vanilla, bourbon on the nose. Silky smooth body with deep dark malt flavours - burnt sugar, molasses, wood. The alcohol is very well integrated. Very good.

750 c&c shared by Marcus. Pours dark brown with a transient beige head. Aroma is quite vinous with some coffee. Full bodied. Flavor is dark malt, chocolate, coffee and a touch of vinosity. Really smooth with a sort of dusty dryness in the finish. Excellent.
Bottle from Beer Revolution. Pours black with almost no head and an intense treacle aroma. There is a smooth smoky dark molasses and coffee flavor with a carbonated finish.

this is one of the best baltic porters i have ever tasted ,even if my aroma score is "just" a 7!
looks good/tastes good..difficult to keep my glass on the table.

Fantastic looking beer.  Looks like motor oil, smells like fresh ground coffee and chocolate.  Very sweet with some dark fruit in there and wood.  Hides the 10% very well.  Light carb, creamy mouthfeel.  Yes, please.

Bouteille 750ml. 2011. Couleur noire opaque, mousse moka très dense, laissant une belle dentelle sur le verre. Arôme intense de café, de chocolat, un peu sucré. Goût tout aussi intense de café, de chocolat noir et dun peu de sucre. Texture riche et crémeuse. Excellente.
merveilleuse biere.choclat noir syrupeuse note de cerise confites ,extremement reconfortante

Pours a dark brown with a nice espresso head that falls to a thin film.  Aroma has chocolate, smoke, raisin cherry.  Taste is sweet with some sweet ans dark chocolate notes.  Full bodied ans semi-sticky.   Really good.

Courtesy of Styles
Bottle: The aroma consists of chocolate, smoke, light roasted coffee, and a touch of black licorice. It pours a dark brown with faint orange highlights. It has a small khaki head that quickly fades to a thin film outlined by a slightly thicker ring. Theres some light webbing left behind for lacing. The flavor starts with heavy cola, chocolate, a good amount of residual sugar, and apple. The finish has some light roasted coffee and a touch of alcohol. Its medium bodied with mild carbonation. Overall, too sweet and it really wears on me quickly.

750ml bottle pours an opaque black with ruby edges and some cloudy, off white head.  Nose is sugary, malty, licorice.  Flavors of licorice, malty, molasses, very heavy licorice.  Full bodied, sticky finish.

Bottle, picked up at Spirit Haus in Amherst, MA.  Big deep brown with a thick, sudsy tan head. aroma is metallic, some light vanilla, cinnamon, light cocoa, and Guinness/nitro stout like dryness. Light fruits and more metal.  Strange.  Flavor has that distinct metallic twang as well, light lactic tartness, some dark fruits, cherry, wood.  Good in a funky sorta way.

Aroma: molasses, coffee
Taste:  molasses, coffee, dark berry, dark chocolate, burnt sugar
Appearance: quite dark, good head
Palate:  thick & unctuous
Sweet with a slight bitterness at the end

Bottle 750 ml. Pours black with brown head. Nice aroma: coffee, roasted malt, chocolate. Awesome taste featuring coffee, roasted malt, chocolate, smoke, and a touch of vanilla. Really sweet (though well balanced) with a slight bitter finish, Thick beer, full bodied. Some nice warming alcohol, though well hidden for a 10% beer. Feels like eating a chocolate cake! Outstanding porter. Only thing is that is a very heavy beer, hard for one person alone to drink, especially since it only comes in 750 ml bottle.

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2012 Bottle 750 ml. Black with a medium light brown head. Aroma is complex: chocolate, raisins, roasted malt, coffee and liquorice. Taste is also quite complex: smokey malt, roasted malt, coffee, dark fruits, liquorice and vanilla. Slight bitterness from the roasted malt. Slight warming alcohol. Body is medium to full. Mouthfeel is thick. Great complexity and well balance beer. This one is more a dessert than a beer. A damn good baltic porter. Main flaw is drinkability... too sugary to drink one big bottle alone (even at two, it aint easy).

Poured from a 750 mL bottle into a tulip.

My pour is a robust mahogany brown color with a walnut edge.  A slight ruby tint is visible in the thin parts of the glass as well.  A medium sized tan head forms initially and fades to a ring over time.

The aroma has a full, smooth roasted malt presence.  Some creamy chocolate, dark cherries, a bit of oak, and vanilla all round out the aroma.

The flavor is quite sweet.  There is a smooth, medium roasted malt with a sweet, dark chocolate presence.  There is a little bit of molasses and vanilla, with a building cherry oak presence and a bit of unspecified dark orchard fruit.  The finish stays sweet, with a touch of smoke, and smooth.

Porter Baltique is smooth, rich, creamy, and definitely masks its 10% ABV very well.  It is unfortunatley sticky and a little too far on the sweet side.  The carbonation is a little lighter than medium and has a creamy nature.  On the other hand, the body is definitely on the full side.

I liked this overall.  It is full and rich, although it may be a bit sweet to drink too much of it.
Black pour with a thin off white head. Smokey meaty chocolate and caramel lead to hints of toffee and molasses. Thick rich palate with ample carbonation and hints of roast in the finish. Awesome.

750mL thanks to ygtbsm94. Deep brune pour. Small mocha foam. Nose is rich berries, smoked sausage, raspberry smoothie, Marmite. Taste is richer, smoky, sharper berries, brown sugar. Palate is nice- refreshing and oily. No off character. Sweeter than I'd like. Smoked character is delicious. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Served from a 750 mL bottle from OTM. The appearance is a deep brown black with a disappearing head. The nose has some dark fruits, a lot of plums and black grapes. Fleshy whole variety that have been sitting in the sun wilting a bit creating a slight sour edge to it. The flavors have the same fruit profile as the noise with more cherry flavors and some raisin as well. There is some fruity coffee there as well but not a dominate flavor. Well carbonated mouth with a slight bitter or spice hint. Really nice beer.

UPDATED: APR 5, 2014 This is definitely a quality beverage. Dark black colour with vibrant aroma of raisins and other dried fruit. Quite a sweet porter. I enjoyed it, but I prefer a more balanced porter. Quality beer. Rerate. Upped a bit.

UPDATED: MAR 7, 2015 750 ml bottle. Pours a very dark brown with full tan head that dissipates slowly leaving fine lacing. Aroma of smoky dark chocolate and coffee. Flavors of roasted malts and chocolate with an oily bitter finish. Rich and smooth. Alcohol is well hidden.

Bottle. Pours opaque black with well retained tan head. Aromas of coffee mocha grassy hop, cream, some toffee. Light-med body, near metallic grassy zesty bitterness and woody smoky body. Near dry finish with a light acidity

750 ml bottle, 2011 vintage.  Served in a nonic pint glass, the beer pours dark brown/black with about an inch tan head.  Head retention is good, and theres a decent amount of lacing.  Aroma is very nice, it smells like roasted malt, bittersweet chocolate, dark fruit (cherries), smoke, and some coffee.  The taste is similar to the aroma, the brew tastes like roasted malt, milk and bittersweet chocolate, tart cherries, plums, smoke, molasses, wood, and a bit of coffee.  Mouthfeel/body is medium/full, its creamy and smooth, and has good, soft carbonation.  I think this is a pretty good overall brew.  Id certainly buy it again.  $12.99 a bottle, bought from Keg Liquors.
Dark  cocolate coffee taste with some smokey flavor, sweet but just enough. Good after taste. I drank the fall  2010 "cuvée".

Pours a three finger tan head that fades quickly to a thin layer leaving some lace. Black color, no highlights, with some yeast left in bottle. Medium carbonation and medium-heavy bodied.  Smoky chocolate nose. Flavor is smoky chocolate and molasses. High ABV is hidden. $11.99 for a 750ml bottle from Beverage Warehouse Winooski, VT.
Black with a light brown head. Aroma is smoke, leather, liquorice. Good body, slightly dry finish. Taste is smoke, liquorice, coffee, dark chocolate.  Very nice.

Huge thatnks to GothGargoyle for bringing this one , thanks man !! 
Head: espresso, foamy 
Colour: black 
Smell: slight smokeyness , little roasty, lots of heavy rich dark chocolat and cocoa powder, slight earthyness and coffee 
Taste: along the line of the aroma , very very well balanced and smooth and richt , truely aesome  !!

UPDATED: SEP 14, 2016 Re-rate 2016. Bottle. Same look. Aroma of figs, toffee, leather, licorice, hints of leather, dried berries. Taste of burned caramel, licorice, prunes, herbs, candy sugar. On the sweet side, but still a fantastic brew. 4.3*

2012. 750ml bottle. Very deep brown, almost black body with a good strong mocha head, nice lacing. Aroma is extremely pleasant, sweet caramel, smoked prunes, hops, toffee, coffee, looks like a smoke beer. Taste is strong roasted malt with a good dose of coffee, tones of smoked prunes, wood charcoal, aggressive bitterness and sourness with a sweet finish, its not light at all. 3.6*

Solid porter. A bit big for my liking but very robust & well balanced. Pours a jet black with a touch of brown head that fades fast. Nose & taste are big on the coffee, chocolate and booze. Interesting beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a black ruby color with little tan head. On the nose its Smokey, sweet wood. Taste is very sweet, lots on different flavors, cherry, and smoked wood. You can taste the alcohol. Of a 10% its a great sipping beer. $13 for a 750ml bottle.

Bottle thanks to Sarah. Pours black with a light brown head that lasts throughout the beer. Aroma has a good amount of roasted malt with a bit of creamy chocolate. Flavor begins with creamy chocolate but finishes roasted malts and a smoke note.

The pour is an opaque black with a moderate, pale tan, pillowy head which is mostly diminishing and leaves minimal, scattered lace.  The nose is cherry and fig, light smoke, some dark chocolate, light roast, and light toasted toffee. The flavor is nice with similar cherry and fig fruit tones, rich toffee, lighter chocolate, light coffee, and toasted almond in there.  The palate is nearly full, less than lively, silky, and round.  The finish is still rich with lots of toffee, figs, light roast, and drying chocolate and almond notes.  A very nice Baltic, not many of these around.  The richness is immense but balanced with fruit and other complexities to make for a harmonious flavor.  The palate fit the beer well and the finish just accented what the flavor had progressed to be.  A very nice beer from a style that you do not find often.

Bottle from Mike12da. Thanks. Heavy, thick chocolate aroma, with a bit of coffee, some vegetal scents, and burnt rubber notes, too. Black with dark tan lacing. Very sharp, sort of metallic sweetness. Nice prune (and somewhat phenolic) aftertaste. Medium body. Really a stout-like porter.

Bottle brought back by Mike12da. Big, full, roasty nose with big chocolate, salty umami, cabbage, phenols. Strange berry and cabbage and chocolate flavor, hugely sweet, too much nasty cabbage. Otherwise would be great.

Pours deep mahogany-tinged black into an English pint. Mocha micro head with excellent retention recedes to skim surface. Dark chocolate and espresso aromas. Soft to medium bodied with sweet dark molasses upfront turning to soy before the lasting charred espresso finish.

750ml bottle.

Pours deep, chocolate brown out of the bottle and settles in pretty close to black with a big thick tan head that leaves spotty lacing.

Aroma is heavily roasted black malts, bakers chocolate and some hints of smoke.  There is also a bit of sweetness, especially the licorice and vanilla.

Taste is even sweeter with malted milk balls coming to mind - sweet chocolate and lactose with espresso and licorice.  The finish is dry with bitter roasted malts and semi-sweet chocolate.

Mouthfeel is medium bodied with lots of carbonation and really, really smooth on the palate.

This is not one of the biggest or most flavorful Baltic porter but its extremely tasty and sweeter in the taste than the nose suggests.

Bottle. Black beerwith a dark tan head. Dark fruit and smoke aroma withmalt. Smoke and malt flavor with dark fruit and light earthiness. Medium-plus bodied. Smoke and toffee lingers with dark fruit and earthiness.

I know some will disagree, but this is my favorite beer so far.  10% of alcohol. in a 750ml format. Its a winter beer. An explosion of flavors in your mouth. Drinking this is a wonderfull experience.

Of course, I would noy drink that on a hot summer day...
From a bottle poured a dark brown color with a almost no head.  Sweet malty flavor with a lingering aftertaste.

Bottle from Rare Beer Club: pours extra dark, reddish brown, thin tan ring. Nose of red wine, vinegar, coffee, raisins, prunes and chocolate. Rich on the palate, dark fruits, cedar, chocolate, brown sugar, molasses, cotton candy and slightly sour and bitter on a long finish. Faint heat. Great Baltic.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750 ml. corked and caged bottle. Pours a thick, lasting beige head, with some lacing, over a dark brown (SRM 35) clear body....nose is heavy chocolate, hints of coffee, strong toffee/caramel,  big dried fruits (plums, cherries, raisins).....taste is chocolate, very heavy dried cherry, heavy toffee/caramel, brown sugar, hints of molasses, smoke and cocoanut, bitterness minimal....mouth feel thick, sticky, alcohol hidden, carbonation low. This confection can be little but a Baltic Porter. It has a very dominantly sweet malt back bone, with all the rich layers of the malts, with minimal hop aroma, flavor and bitterness. It is overly sweet to me. BJCP 7/3/14/4/7
bottle, dense red brown color with some thin foam , aroma of balsamic, red wine, coffee, flavor of balsamic vinegar, coffee, black licorice, red velvet cake, just enough hops with a great finish

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2012 2011 Vintage. 10%. Lots of roast, bitter chocolate and a little vanilla in the aroma. Flavor is sweet chocolate and bites on the palate. Finishes silky with a subtle carbonation. A little too sweet. Well done but leaves something to be desired. Id like to age another to allow some of the sweetness to mellow and let some flavor develop and meld.

APPEARANCE: jet black, couple fingers tan head. Dissipates quickly but not much carbonation. SMELL: woody, vanilla, chocolate, coffee. Great first impression. TASTE: a dark roastiness at the start with some chocolate hanging around. Nicely sweet. Cherries and vanilla. Is it possible to be chocolate and vanilla?! A little bitterness creeps in late. Complexity is out of control. (thats good). PALATE: not heavy, smooth, easy to drink, but you can feel it warming all the way down. Dont think Ive ever tasted a beer thats felt like that before. This is phenomenal. These guys never disappoint. 2 thumbs up.
Jet black colour. Thin off white head which quickly dissipates. Vinegar aroma. Rich flavour of fruit and chocolate. Harsh finish. May have gone past its date. Would love to sample again fresh.

Not sure where I bought this one, but has been in my cellar a while. "Édition Limitée, Automne 2008" written instead of "Grand Cuvée". Pours a real dark colour with little red highlights. The head is beige-brown coloured, decent sized, frothy, has good retention and leaves a bit of lace. The aromas are strong with some plums, raisins, coffee, molasses and hints of chocolate. Beautiful silky smooth and even a little creamy mouthfeel with absolutely no burning. You can really taste the roasted malts in the flavours, giving that burnt smokiness that lingers. A very nice light bitterness holds up, with the coffee and chocolate. Notes of cherries are very well-hidden as well. Quite happy I have held on to this one, but will have to try a more up-to-date version to see if it is as smooth and easy to drink. Would of never known this was a 10% ABV brew if it was not written.

Louverture de la bouteille laisse passer des aromes de café corsé et de chocolat. Robe noire foncé. En bouche, le moka, la melasse et un léger goût de fruits séchés. Légère amertume et carbonatation assez douce. Simplement le meilleur porter baltique de 2010.

Dark brown/black with a medium sized tan head. Sweet chocolate nose with raisins, toffee, some alcohol and roast. The flavor is lightly sweet, very lightly bitter with lots of chocolate, raisins, alcohol, molasses and prunes. Full body is round with moderate carbonation.

750ml brown bottle, corked. 2011. Deep brown in colour, mahogany highlights. Generous tan head, thick consistency, light spots of lace. Nose is slightly smoky, chocolate malts, light fruit. Taste has a sweet cherry like fruitiness up front, deep caramel, smoky and chcolately malts too. Smoke lingers in the finish, bitter black coffee notes, black cherry tang, roasty malts and some cocoa as well. Pretty rich throughout, not heavy handed with alcohol notes. Smooth mouthfeel, medium bodied, soft carbonation, the soft texture works with the richness of this beer. Smokiness was not expected, but works great. I rarely enjoy Baltic Porter this much, but this has a lot going for it.

Belle bière noire coiffée dune belle mousse couleur mocha. Étrangement, ce sont les olives noires marinées que je perçoit comme odeurs des louverture de la bouteille. Ça disparaît aussitôt pour laisser la place à des arômes de crème brûlée, de malt grillé, de carrés aux dattes et de dattes séchées qui ont commencé à macérer. En bouche, un goût agréablement moelleux de mélasse, de malt rôti qui laisse un arrière-goût surette, qui revient allégrement, accompagné dune forte présence dalcool. Belle rondeur. (159-301011/090212)
Aroma is chocolate, caramel. Taste is sweet of cherry, port, present carb, bitter and sweet aftertaste. A favourite
Rich, smooth, resolved with as much chocolate/coffee notes as one could expect without them being explicitly added.

Near black pour, 1 finger of head, very slight ruby hues.  Roasted malt, Dark cherry, blackberry, very inviting aroma.  Very slight sourness that completely disappears when this hits room temperature.  Roasted mallt, very slight smokiness, dark cherry, blueberry, blackberry, coffee, burnt toffee.  Thick body.  Dangerously easy to drink for a 10% porter.  Serve it a couple degrees below room temperature.

Bottle - 750 mL corked and caged. Vintage 2011 at 10% ABV. Black pour with a short, fizzy tan head. Aroma is smoky with strong roasted malt, dark fruit notes and hints of chocolate. Taste is rather sweet with roasted malt, chocolate notes, dark fruit, coffee, burnt caramel, soft smokiness, and light woody notes. Body is medium with a strong, bubbly carbonation. Finishes with sweet and roasted malt, chocolate covered cherries, coffee notes and soft smokiness.

this brewery always intrigues me... pours a deep ruby brown .. . instant coffee, light tar, roasty charcoal, and light bitterness .. . enjoyable, but i wanted at least some kind of smoke .. . . When, boy? When, ..are you gonna get your act together?

Deep black with a generous frothy light brown head that retained well and left magnificent lacing. Rich aromas of dark fruits like plums and figs, blackberries, chocolate, coffee and smoke. Flavors are similar and similarly complex, with the chocolate and coffee notes coming through a bit stronger, and the addition of brown sugar and molasses. Full body, slick mouthfeel, soft carbonation and a finish that features dark fruit sweetness and alcohol warmth.

Bouteille 750mL, cuvee 2011. Nez dominant de melasse avec des notes de fumee et de tabac. Bouche cremeuse et intense ou le sucre laisse place a lalcool a la fin: beaucoup de melasse et un peu de cacao.
bottle from rare beer club. pours medium body black with amazing dark tan head. aroma of roasted oats and brown sugar. taste deep roasted oat and nuts slight char taste.

from bottle, Ive had this on my shelf for a while i thought i was saving it for something but i may as well drink it. pours a black colour, some caramel around the edges. terrible head in my opinion clearly a result of carbonation it fizzes strongly and dissipates promptly. lovely aroma, deep rich malty notes, sugary sweetness, dark cocoa nibs, maybe some apples and berrys. A richly complex flavour, typical burst of roasted malts combined with chocolate and coffee, prominent coffee bitterness in the aftertaste. Superbly balanced beer. A bit dissapointed to find how fizzy it was it causes a poor head and an unpleasant tingly on the tongue, its unessecary in my opinion.

Oh my word oh my word oh my word.  This is so many wonderful things all at once.  Pours inky black, plus nice head.  Aromas are - where to start? Black cherry? Coffee? Chocolate? Bacon? Smoke? Leather? Blackberries?  All that in one beer?  Yes, and more - and just flat out delicious.  Warming alcohol is an exclamation point.  A treat.

Holy hell, this beer is too awesome and while they state the obvious, we will not.... Not a single thing out of place and everyone agrees. The nose of this years version is so unique and delectable, like a can of the finest smoked oysters, oily and rich with a hint of smoke and unagi... The amazing colour seems to suck light in so much that it makes a black hole look opaque. Once you get through the intensity of the colour you notice the head is tanned and laces with the elegance of Chantilly lace while the viscosity means it hangs on the glass like fine aged port. The palate has so much rich chocolate and coffee but that amazing soy cured eel lingers and couples with the smokiness to produce the finest liquid meal I have ever consumed. The length is nearly as dense as the colour and I know this will sit in my throat long after the 12 or so other beers I will consume this evening have come and gone. This is the Dali of beers... Unique, intense and one any beer lover should not pass up. Would love to see how it develops in 2-5 years too, 3 going to cellar tonight.

Jan. 2, 2012; 750 mL 10% abv. No BBD.
A pretty young bottle. 1/7/11. The noses is of fruits, cherry and lychee, with some smokey malts and sweetness. Some spicy alcohol as well. Pours a black with little tan head. Creamy lacing on the glass. Tastes of coffee, chocolate malts with a fruity sweetness. Bitterness comes through with some more smoke and alcohol. Coats the back of the throat. Wish I had another bottle to age a bit longer.
#1019 bottle; Nose is decent cane sugar, medium sweet roasted malt, alcohol whiff, cream, feel is medium, carb is medium, taste is sour roasted malt, plum, alcohol, coffee, velvet hops finish

Odeur chocolaté a souhait.  Une super mousse chocolaté abondante avec un robe noire presque totalement opaque.  Un goût exquis ou le sucre domine en entré suivi par une légère torréfaction.  En soit, une porter typique mais léquilibre est parfait, le goût est très clean et le palais est excellent; juste assez épais avec une finale qui vous suit longtemps sans quon sen lasse.
Bottle.  Dark brown pour with a tan head.  Smoke and roasted malt nose.  Sweet and smokey notes.  I usually do not care for Baltic Porters, but this is very good.
This beer is outstanding.  I cant help but feel that it will only get better with age.  It was the perfect night cap.  Thick, heavy, cultured, yeasty....notes of blue cheese even.

Pours beautiful jet black with a foamy brown head. Nose of cocoa, sourdough yeast, wine, toasty cereal, port, and brine. It has a shiraz-like sweetness and pumpernickel bread. Lactic acid. Coffee and Chocolate. Dark Caramel, macerated fruit and old honey. HIdes alcohol extremely well. Surprisingly light bodied and drinkable this young. Finish is very satisfying.

Appearance: Pours an opaque dark brown, frothy dark beige head. Aroma: Caramel, butterscotch, chocolate, coffee, some other notes I dont recognise. Slightly woody, nutty. Palate: thick bodied, creamy, smooth, not much carbonation, but its not flat. quite a slow, dry finish. Taste: Starts off very sweet, and moves to a faintly bitter finish. Strong coffee and chocolate notes. Pretty good.
Bottle: pours dark black with a thin tan head, aroma of chocolate, malt, coffee, smokiness, taste is chocolate, malt, roasty, smooth.  Nice.

Really good from the get-go.  Smell starts strong with roast malt.  Taste has some caramel and more roast malt before the more stoutish-tastes like bitter chocolate.  First breath after livens up the mocha and nutiness.  Just saw my first snowfall in two years and a good thick porter is perfect for the cold.

2011 edition. From a 750 ml bottle into a snifter. Pours a deep, dark brown, almost pitch black with some orange reflects and a thin brown head. Smells of caramel, coffee and oak. Tastes of strong caramel, toffee, maybe 70-75%-ish black chocolate and dates. The alcohol definitely is present, yet it helps balance all the caramel, chocolate and dry fruit taste. Aftertaste of very subtle espresso, leaves a persistent, lingering roasted malt flavor. Has a very unctuous, oily texture, with a weak level of carbonation which definitely leaves ample room for all of its flavor.  A true masterpiece, which I can definitely call my all-time favorite lager.

Pours a rich black with a hint of red. Sweet and smoky aroma, very nice. Taste is just a bit smoky, with a lot of malty sweet backup. Dark dark caramel with complex notes of coffee and just a hint of vanilla and toffee. No indication that its as strong as 10%, and not much indication of hops either. This is one tasty beer. Tasting courtesy of my excellent cousin kevinsenn.

UPDATED: DEC 1, 2011 750mL (10% ABV) bottle from Broue Ha Ha.  Pours opaque black with no head.  Aroma is pleasant and smokey.  Pleasant sweet and smoky taste.  Love this stuff!  Medium-full body.  Like a Doppelbock on steroids.  A really great brew.

On the border between dark brown and jet black... really, its only the chocolate tinted head that allows any light into the glass. Sweet malty aroma that also gives off a touch of graininess. Thick on the tongue and just full of flavors - bitter chocolate, some roasted malt, coffee and a hint of hoppiness finished off with spice.

A truly majestic brew. An epic!
very herbaceous aroma. pretty good porteresque taste. it was better as it warmed up, a little too sweet for my liking though.  very heavy mouthfeel which I liked, almost like syrup

Man the LCBO on Howard really got some great stuff in.  This is the 3rd beer Ive found in the top 99%.  Very very dark brown pour, hazy with a tan head.  Strong raisin and berry scent.  Thick sweet mouth.  Lots of caramel, roast and smoke.  Dark sweet and rich is the best I can describe this.  Rather nice.  I think I would prefer just a touch less sweet.  The one thing I really dont taste is anything boozy which is surprising based on the percentage.
(bottle) very dark brown with small brown head; aromas of coffee, fruit; rich balanced flavour, long light bitter finish; excellent

Loads of sweet malts, sweet burnt malts, fruit,and an odd olive oil aroma. Very sweet flavor more of this semi tart roasted malt. Very good mouthfeel, a touch oily. Great roasty finish, lots of espresso, and burnt malts. A nice porter, but not great.

Pours deep black with a rich, thick brown head.  Sweet chocolate and roasted malt aromas.  Bittersweet taste with roasted malt and chocolate flavors with a hit of alcohol.  Lingering smokey finish is quite satisfying. 

Great beer, amazing flavor profile!

Oh my god! These Chocodiles, Francine. Oh my god, these Chocodiles, Oh my God. Is pretty much what comes to mind when I drink this beer, but change chocodiles to Porter Baltique, and Francine to Les Trois Mousquettaires. . . .doesnt really have the same kind of flow, but im sure you get the picture. This beer is epic. Pours thick and dark, pretty much motor oil. The aroma is really good, well made coffee, chocolate, something sour....black currents? molasses, awesomeness. The flavour  is equally as awesome, coffee, chocolate, raisins, red wine, cherries, black currants, more chocolate and anise in the finish. Flippin fantastic.

This was good. Lots of dried fruit, chocolate and brown sugar in the aroma with a bit of a herbal/spicy note. It is quite sweet and quite boozy. I split the 750ml bottle with a friend and would happily have drunk another.

750ml bottle Well...this is probably one of my favourite porter/stouts Ive yet had. Its a beautiful beer in a beautiful bottle. Pours black with a nice tan head. Aroma is earthy and hoppy with a lot of warm chocolate in there. In the mouth its silky and rich...chocolate, hops, earth, dirt, roasted malt sweetness. A little bit of alcohol but its in the backbone. Everything in its right place. "Like bathing in honey."

2011 Grande Cuvée. Pours a deep, dark brown with a small coffee coloured head. Nose is blackcurrant, cherry, chocolate, and raisin. Simple and subdued, but pleasant. Mouth feel is medium-thin and very dry with good carbonation. Taste-wise, very sweet with roasted malts and dark fruit up front: blackcurrant, cherries, and  black grapes; very winy.  Underneath lies cherry syrup, black licorice, coffee, burnt toast, dark chocolate, a hint of smoke, and a slight metallic note. Booziness is pleasant, warming and hidden very nicely by the sweetness. Finish is long, dry and nicely bitter. A very delicious dessert brew.

750ml bottle 
10.0% ABV (as written on bottle) 
I tried this beer on October 22, 2011 after purchasing from the Yonge/Wellesley LCBO in Toronto, Ontario, Canada.  The beer poured a dark brownish-black colour with a thin long lasting tan coloured head.  Coffee, smoke, chocolate and figs dominated the aroma.  Mouthfeel is medium to full bodied with medium carbonation.  The flavour is smoked wood, chocolate, cherries and hints of chocolate and vanilla.

Bouteille 750ml (Grande cuvée 2011). Brun foncé avec un pouce de collet beige assez persistant. Arômes herbacés, légèrement floral. Goût de chocolat prononcé, noisettes grillées, discrètement rôti avec une finale sèche et bien équilibrée légèrement épicée et florale. Léquilibre est du côté de lamertume et le corps moyen. Excellente bière, rafraîchissante et facile à boire malgré ses 10.5% dalcool.

Rubis très foncé, pas tout à fait noir total avec un collet moka très vivant. Au nez, je suis très surpris pas la fumée qui domine facilement le bouquet, légèrement accompagné par la levure probablement responsable des figues/dattes. En bouche, elle peinture bien le palais et laisse une traînée de sucre résiduels riches et fumés. Le chocolat et le café sont présent comme acteurs de soutiens. Onctueux et savoureux.

750 ml bottle from La Barik.  Pours a near-black, very dark brown with modest-sized beige head.  Aroma is raisin, alcohol, anise and chocolate.  Flavour is lots of raisin and licorice with sweet chocolate and some roasty coffeeness.  Moderate alcohol warmth in finish.  Quite nice.
750ml bottle. Murky dark brown with light brown head. Light chocolate, some coffee, smoke, malts, lots of metal on the aroma and palate. Decent carbonation, some malt, alcohol, smoke, decent finish.

On tap. Black with a thin beige head with below average retention. Aroma is very sweet with chocolate, alcohol, raisins, vanilla, caramel and a hint of wood. Flavor is similar, but too sweet to enjoy more than a glass. This was much sweeter than I remembered, I shall try the bottled version to compare. Full body, moderate carbonation, liquorous mouthfeel.

750mL corked bottle poured almost black with a small beige head and some spotted lacing.  Aromas of chocolate and roasted malt dominate with a hint of smoke.  Taste is malty sweet with chocolate and some coffee bitterness.  Overall, this is a finely balanced beer which masks the alcohol nicely.
Tasted at Seaport Beer festival. has a winey aroma but is pleasant: grains and cereal and roast. more of the same on the palate. Decent brew.
Near black pour with a mocha head. Smoke, licorice, anise, earth with a vinous quality on the nose. Smoke, licorice and earth dominate the palate with a slightly boozy burn in the finish.

Ebony body with a foamy olive-colored head. Sublime complex aromas of  plum, caramel, smoke, molasses and chocolate. Creamy mouthfeel and modest carbonation. High slicky taste of burnt malt, caramel, leather, smoke and chocolate. AYAYAYE. Impressive.

Poured from 750ml bottle into chalice glass. Deep black with a tan-brown hue. Little head, and any is lost quite quickly. Aroma is like a fortified wine, rich dark fruits, liquorice, chocolate, sweetness and alcohol. Taste is potent and complex with bit hits of molasses, dark sweet fruits, coffee and some bitter chocolate. Despite the hugeness it is easy on the mouth, low to medium carbonation, a long lingering finish. Very warming. An excellent better than maybe is a tiny bit undone by its own hugeness causing slight unbalanced taste. Nonethelessyum and moreish!
Bottle thanks to Dany. Pours black. Tan head. Nose/taste of mocha pie, deep roasted chocolate, vanilla and roast coffee. Medium body. Sweet and sticky mouth feel. Lots of cocoa in finish.

Pours black with deep red and brown glimpsed when held up to the light.  Large and lively, but tight head.  Perfectly roasted malts in the taste, nothing bitter or burnt.  Leaves a nice aftertaste too.

Its hard not to give this top marks in every category.  Great great porter.

Pours black with a big mocha head. Aroma is of rich chocolate scents and coffee along with some roasted grain malts and a little liquorice. Taste is somewhat overly sweet with not much bitterness at all really. Full body, thick on the palate and soft carbonation. Overall a nice, maybe overpowering porter.

Previously not a huge porter fan, but this is fantastic! 750ml bottle with champagne cork. Low carbonation, laces nicely. Powerful aroma and a big mouthfeel. The taste got better as it got warmer (or is that just as the bottle got emptier?) Chocolate was the dominant flavour, with toffee, toast, caramel, liquorice and vanilla all getting a look in too.
I got 3 more bottles to put away, but its hard to leave them alone.

750 ml bottle. Cork was hard to get off. Poured hazy dark brown with small light tan head. Very clean aroma of dark malts, toast and roast. Taste is very similar with a very smooth clean finish. Very well done.

UPDATED: NOV 5, 2011 Bottle, pours a black with a nice lacying. taste is fairly smooth with a bit of bitter notes. the finish is smooth. Overall this was interesting stuff, thanks for the share

Had a again and liked it alot more, it had tons of chocolate taste, really it was quite enjoyable

Very dark brown, near black pour, dark tan head.  Big aroma on this, big enough that I smelled it four feet away while slicing jalapenos.  Sweet licorice, coffee, chocolate, caramel, loads of roasty char.  This is very sweet tasting, but has enough of a roasty char and bitterness as it finishes to make it still very enjoyable.  Loaded chocolate, vanilla, and licorice.  Awesome, and a perfect beer for celebrating.
Black color/ tan head. Chocolate, licorice, deep roast malt aromas. Medium body. Sugar, black licorice, chocolate, coffee, dark roast malt flavors--good.
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: Bottle, 2010 version. Black with a tan head that fades to a coat but laces well. Aroma of dark sugars, chocolate, licorice, grass. Slightly syrupy mouthfeel. Sweet with burnt sugars, licorice, vanilla, chocolate, some grassy and herbal hop bitterness. Holds the alcohol pretty well - its not fumey and theres no finishing burn - although its rich and warming. The big sweetness is kept under some semblance of control by the bitterness, but theres no great depth to the black malts. Good.

Bottle and Tap. Tap preffered. Fantastic brew. Silky smooth and lingering. Pours a deep dark rich brown (mostly black) with a small quickly falling brown head. Aroma of chocolate, molasses, dark sweet fruits and a dash of coffee. Rich, smooth and delish.

Bottle 75 cl at Papsø. Courtesy of fiulijn.
Very dark brown, thin texture, very sweet. Flat. Some smoke and liquorice.

Cask Stillage at Toronto Cask Days festival Volo, Toronto 30/10/2010
Fruity aroma. Black strong in alcohol and rich on the palate with a hint of dryness in a bitter and yeasty malt finish.

Bottle at Papsø.
Clear red brown coloured with a small beige ehad.
Sweet and roasted aroma of caramel and dark chocolate with notes of liquorice, smoke and cocoa powder.
Sweet and roasted flavour of caramel, dark chocolate and dried fruits.
Sweet and roasted finish.

UPDATED: DEC 28, 2016 2016-12-28, Sergeys hunt, corked bottle, October 2015, 1 year old, 8-4-9-4-18=43One year of age may made it a bit mellower, but still deep and balanced. Will keep the score.2011-04-08, corked bottle from Brewery Creek, Vancouver, Automne 2010, 8-4-9-4-18=43Very dark color, close to black, but with dark tobacco shades on the side; very small head.Aroma of roasted malt and coffee, with an interesting leather wrapping, and some wood.Strong body, the mouthfeel is a bit oily, and the carbonation is quite low; perfect blend of chocolate, caramel, roasted malts, supported by the sweetness level that I like, with a balanced bitter final; some traces of tobacco, liquorice, alcohol, roasted nuts.A great beer!

Bottle 75 cl. Courtesy of fiulijn. Pours pitch black with a small beige head. Hard roast malt aroma, sweet dried fruit, a little tar and manure (meant as something positive!) Rich body, low carbonation, sweet hard roast, dark dried fruits, wood, vanilla and tar. Very subdued bitterness. 080411

Bottled. A dark brown beer with a thin dark brown beer. The aroma has notes of alcohol, roasted malt, and chocolate. The flavor is sweet with alcohol, roasted malt, caramel, and chocolate,  leading to a dry and roasted finish.

shared by alex.
pitch dark,  almost no head.
lots of hard roasted grains in the aroma . roasted malts.
flavor is roasted stuff, roasted malts, sweet malts, brown sugar.  roasted and sweet.  faint licorice. Very tasty, a bit on the sweet side.

75 cL bottle, courtesy of fiulijn. Pours dark brown with a small tan head. Aroma is roasted, malty and slight metallic to smoked. Light blood note. Dark malty and liqourice to dark roasted. Dark malty and slight smoked and liqourice note finish.

750ml bottle, corked n caged, thanks to flipper2gv on BA.  Nearly black in color with a large tan head that leaves a thick tan ring on the glass. The aroma bursts out of the glass with big dark chocolate, roast, anise, and coffee.  Classic and great with no one smell standing out.  The flavor is enormous, with sweet dark chocolate, slight espresso, roastiness, caramel, and maybe even some dark fruity notes, raisin and black cherry maybe.  Smooth and silky mouthfeel with fairly full body and slight carbonation.  Overall this is excellent.  Probably top 5% in the style.

750 ml bottle. Pours a pure black color with a large brown head. A sweet smoky dark fruity nose, some caramel. The flavor is excellent; rich smoky sweet malts, dark fruit, caramel, a very good example of the style. Heavy but drinkable.

UPDATED: APR 15, 2012 Bottle from Mane Liquor. Huge Porter. Huge ! Black pour with a big, foamy tan head. Complex aroma of chocolate, liquorice, coffee and smoked malts. Taste has a big emphasis on coffee and peat. Rich, thick dark chocolate in there as well. Soft and smooth mouthfeel. Bloody awesome

Sous un opulent col brunâtre, cette bière débène totalement opaque offre un bouquet darômes spectaculaires de café, dalcool, de céréales grillées avec une note de cerises.  Sa solide amertume équilibre les relents de sucre laissés par la fermentation haute.  Cest une bière sirupeuse avec un corps très généreux qui possède une effervescence modeste, mais durable.  Une bière de dégustation.

Bottle via tytoanderso, thanks a billion!   Automne 2008Pours a beautiful dark brown with luscious brown head that paints the glass with each swirl.  Thick Baltic porter-like nose steaming with malty and slightly salty sensations of nuts, chocolate, and berries but  also foreshadowing a big, thick, malty monster of a beer, and I hope it comes through... Nice, thick malty flavors bring back the chocolate and nuts and sprinkle them with a touch of saltiness.  Nice thick body, perfectly balancing hop bitterness, and body-accentuating alcohol thats neither hot nor boozy. The perfect execution of the hopping in this beer really sets it apart from most Baltic Porters IMO..it really just pops this beer to whole other level.  Practically perfection within Baltic Porter parameters, at least in what I consider Baltic Porter perfection...which of course could very well deviate from official style guidelines but I dont really give a rats ass about style guidelines.  Love it!

Medium sized head very dark porter mild carbonation aroma rich chocolate liccorice coffee sugary sweet note flavour very sweet porter coffee and five sugars that what it tastes like liccorice rich enough to put pimples on a crocodile,have drank some good sweet ones but this one is different no smoothness just dose not go down well at all

Poured from a 750 ml bottle purchased at Depanneur Peluso in Montreal. Black pour with a big, creamy light tan head. Aroma holds smoked malt in the foreground, with notes of caramel, chocolate, and lactic cream on the second tier. Flavor is much sweeter and richer, with greatly increased chocolate notes, like fudge brownie. The smoke backs off, replaced with molasses and a touch of coffee. Beautiful silky smooth mouthfeel. Really a damn good baltic porter.

Poured from a 750ml bottle into a snifter. Dark chocolately brown with a slight reddish hue. No head to speak of. Chocolate on the aroma, with an oaky touch to it. Outstanding smooth flavour of coffee and oak. Beautiful velvety softness and a bitter (but completely pleasant) after taste. Outstanding, very good.

[on tap]
Potent vanilla and rum aroma with a little coffee and cinnamon. Oily, almost opaque black appearance, under some thin foam dots. Tangy ethanol together with strong vanilla and bitter coffee. Molasses accent and detectable hops. Medium body, moderately warming, moderate carbonation, moderate vanilla tang finish.

Chocolate caramel nose, pours a dark dark brown with a very dark brown head. Taste is an almost smoky, toasted caramel flavour dominating with a warming spicinessstaying on the tongue well after the beer is gone.
Pours a nice dark brown colour with a chocolate coloured head. Aroma is strong dark chocolate and coffee and the taste is similar.  super smooth light alc, and sweet sticky on the palate. Great beer

750ml bottle shared by jsprime. simply put, this is the best baltic porter ive ever tried. a stunningly perfect example of the style. Les Trois Mousquetaires might be the most underrated brewery on the planet. thx jeff!

UPDATED: DEC 10, 2011 EDIT: 2011 vintage: big changes this year, but no less outstanding. Instead of molasses, Im getting big cherry in the middle. Rest is the same though, big in the mouth, beautiful in the glass. what a beer. 

This is a fantastic beer from one of PQs great micros. Intense coffee and acohol aroma with.hint of molasses. Top notch.

Extreme dark chocolate brown with a thick skiff floating on top that got replenished with each swirls of the glass. Massive sweet malty aroma, milk chocolate, caramel, some mild spice. Smells so epically good its just so heavy and smooth I cant stop smelling. Yum yum yum.taste is also epic!! Thick milk chocolate, and heavy roasted malts hints coffee, dark berry sweetness and a vanilla finish. Flavor is actually kind of simple but sooooooo dam good. I love this beer

Great pour! Comes out thick with its black colour and huge dark foamy brown crown that settles down to light cover. Excellent aromas of sweet caramel, molasses, soft chocolate, light licorice, 50/50 bread, faint spice, smells much better early on. Tasty! Chocolate (lots), plenty of toasted malts,  vanilla, notable spice when warmer, touch of heat, vanilla, caramel. Thick, viscous mouth feel, leaves a carpet of coating and a great finish. Started out great then got a bit stale then finished STRONG. Awesome.

750ml Bottle. Thick black pour with a small foamy tan head that doesnt last long. Rich, sweet aroma has notes of dark chocolate, liquorice, dates, brandy, caramel and raisins. The flavour is very close to the aroma with the chocolate and dark fruits standing out. Thick, creamy mouthfeel with moderate to low carbonation and a lingering roasty, lightly bitter finish with a hint of warmth from the alcohol. This is definitely in the dessert beer category, rich and sweet, and also very good.

Yeah, its probably a five for appearance - a great dark beige head and an amber-black body. The aroma is paint thinner, syrup, leather and cherry. Flavour is roasted and nearly burnt barley backed up by a syrupy malt finish. This stuff was seriously expensive and for the price I paid, it should have been waaaay better. As it stands, it just tastes like a cheap porter.

Excellent. 750 ml for dessert. Rich and full bodied. I mean really full bodied for the style. Nose has a bit too much alcohol for my liking, but he dark fruit and faint whiffs of chocolate permeate the ethanol. Immediate chocolate with a silky smoothness. Round off with a moderate roast and dark fruit finish. Could easily be confused as an Imperial Stout. A real finesse beer. A bit going on, but not quite as complex as the true greats of the Imperial Stout world, but easily the best baltic porter iI have ever had. Classy in every sense of the world. Sir, I challenge you to a duel!

UPDATED: AUG 31, 2013 pours jet black with a creamy brown head, excellent retention and lacing. sweet dark roasted malts all over, real semi-sweet dark chocolate, some smoke, caramelized and burnt figs and plums with grassy hops that support superbly the beer. moderate carbonation, medium body - oily, sticky but not cloying. excellent!

Bottle (from Autumn 2010) via a trade with savvy1982. Black pour with a thick tan head that slowly fades. Aromas are smokey, with a huge milk chocolate note. Further notes of raisins and leather. Flavors of raisins, dark fruits, cocoa, tobacco, smokey with a huge dark chocolate presence.

Excellent beer.
Bottle from glouglouglouburrrrrp. Dry doughy cocoa with a big molasses and dark chocolate kick.  Sweet syrupy dark chocolate cut nicely by bitter cocoa and tangy plum skins. Pretty good.

The pour is almost entirely black. Hints of brown are distinguishable in the body. Head started as 2-3 fingers of tan and ends with almost no head at all. The aroma is a sweet chocolate and coffee roasted complexion. Nice alcohol on the nose mixes well with the other dark aromas. The taste starts as a sweet coffee, chocolate and roasted toffee. Ends with a brutal alcohol burn and espresso bitterness. Very nice taste. Smooth and syruppy mouthfeel with full body. Moderate carbonation and extremely nice lacing. This is truly one of the best beers I have had the joy of tasting in 2010.
Pretty darn good porter. Un autre excellent produit Québecois. Si les 3M SE concentre sur ce genre de bière, on pourrait assister à de bonne bière.

Via trade with Savvy1982. Pours solid black with a rich creamy brown head. Aroma of caramel and mild smoke. Taste is strong, lots of malt body, some smoke again and dark chocolate or coffee bitterness on the finish. Very smooth and creamy.

750mL bottle, sent from Glouglouburp, pours black with a small tan head. Chocolate, roasted malt and espresso on the nose, with a smoky quality as well. Flavour is extremely well-rounded and rich - typical for this brewer - with chocolate malts, substantial roasted notes, light espresso, and a subtle cherry-like fruitiness. Slightly bitter finish, with the alcohol undetectable. Most excellent.

Torrefied malt and dark chocolate aromas with a hint of liquorice.  Smooth texture with low carbonation leads the way to dark chocolate flavors, yielding quickly to a torrefied coffee taste and an ending in strong alcohol and slight toffee hints.  Theres a nice light bitterness throughout the tasting process which makes for this beers unique profile.  Perfect fall beer next to the fireplace waiting for the game to begin ... as i am now!!!!
Tap at Volo (in cask). Masterpiece. Aromas of coffee, caramel, and chocolate. Taste is sweet, with bitter notes, and very long length. Palate is syrupy, and full bodied. Black, head disappears.

Bottle. Pours viscous black. Tan head, spotty lacing. Nose is chocolate, licorice, ash, creosote, super-classy smoke notes too. Flavours of smoke, cherries, chocolate, creamy malt notes, super dark roast coffee, very rich and flavorful, and magnificent. One of the finest brews that Ive had in a long while.

Sampled at Vice et Versa in Montreal. Pours a solemn black with light brown head. Aroma is coffee, cocoa, port, caramel. Taste is deep and rewarding with thick mocha like notes, licorice, caramel. Excellent.

750 ml bottle, 2009. Pours jet black with a 2 finger thick head thats the color of a brown paper bag. Not much in the way of lace. Sweet caramel & chocolate aroma. Very enticing. Creamy, moderately thick palate. A pleasure to drink. Taste is molasses, bakers chocolate, pumpernickel, licorice, roasted nut and a somewhat bitter finish. Very nice porter.

On cask for Cask Days at Volo in Toronto. Served in an English pint glass. Pours red-black with a small, rocky tan head. The head remains but leaves no lace. The nose has notes of roasted malt, coffee, flowers and herbal hops. The flavour is moderately sweet throughout with notes of herbs. It acquires a moderate bitterness towards the end. The finish is long and bitter, with prominent dry hopping. It is full in body with a smooth, syrupy texture and soft carbonation. Overall, I was impressed by this beer. The dry hopping was a nice complement. 2010-10-29

Intense parfum de cacao, davoine et de vanille avec insistance sur les notes chocolatées. Alcool pas trop présent en bouche mais se fait néanmoins sentir après quelques gorgées. Lalcool se fait très présent toutefois si vous décidez de boire à même le goulot après avoir jeûné pendant le Ramadan.  Robe noire, modérément épaisse.  Amertume légère. Belle douceur. Maintenant jva mcoucher. Une très bonne bière.

Bottle. Pours black with shades of brown. Thick and creamy tan head with modereate rentention. Aroma is blackcherry, wood, coffee, ash and plums. Taste is less coffee-heavy than aroma suggests, but a bit more chocolatey and smokey. Long, chocolate finish. This is the 2010 edition.

UPDATED: OCT 5, 2011 En fût. Cuvée 2010, 2011. 10%. Couleur noire comme la nuit, mousse beige-brune assez persistante. Arôme complexes de mélasse, cerises noires, café et réglisse noire. En bouche, très douce et crémeuse. Notes de mélasse, un peu de réglisse noire, despresso et aussi un peu de chocolat noir et chocolat au lait. Un peu de bois en bouche.Finale douce, de café et dalcool avec une légère amertume. Vraiment Excellente.

Aroma is vinious with chocolate, toffee and cherries. Pours black with a caramel coloured head. Flavour is a bit smoked with chocolate, coffee, toffee and vinious with a hint of cherries. Nice and  full palate with a long chocolaty aftertaste. High carbonation.

Bottle. [thanks, cfrancis]
Pour is completely black with a fine, staying, frothy, beige head. Slightly fizzy. Aroma has good malty tartness, blackberries, roasted malts, dark chocolate, figs, raisins and liqourice. Highish carbonation, lively, creamy yet elegantly easy mouthfeel. Flavour is very complex. Lots of dark chocolate throughout. Raisins, some roasted malts and quite a firm malty astringent tartness. Blackberries, light coffee. Very long, lingering, warming and light malty bitter aftertaste. This is quite a great example of the style where malts are used for both sweetness, alcohol, bitterness and tartness. Great!

UPDATED: AUG 21, 2010 2009 bottle from Alain at Peluso, whom I paid for it. Very dark blackish brown, brown cap is denser than Moose from Archie comics. Aroma is herbal sweet and fruit. Tastes grapey. chocolatey, and has an earthy herbal presence.Has a bit of roast, and some restrained bitterness. its more just another sweet fruity Quebec beer than it is a real Baltic Porter, to be quite honest. But its well-made. ** update ** the next dat this is drinking just as well and Im getting a little wild blueberry in the flavors, nice Up the flavors .1 despite the predominant Quebec sweetness - still a sexy beer.
RBSG Tasting. Nice grainy aroma. Chocolate flavor. Nice coffee. Over carbonated.

astoundingly beautiful beer.   smooth, rich, silken chocolate, with the merest heat belaying the 10% alc.  Long, warm, rich, mouthfilling finish.  Astoundingly clean, and smooth. 

Super super beer.

750mL bottle from Marche Omni. Pours totally opaque black with a large mocha head. Aroma is very much in line with an Imperial Stout, loads of dark fruity esters and roasted malts. Awesome. Flavour is even better, lots of bitter roast but balanced super well with rich sweet chocolate. Raisins, red grapes, vanilla, caramel, subtle hint of smoke. Velvety smooth as well, very little hint of the alcohol. Reminds me of a milk stout, theres almost a lactic sweetness here that I really enjoy. Minor dryness in the finish from the yeast. Holy crap this stuff is tasty, wish I bought more. This brewery is freaking amazing.

C&C 750 mL bottle shared by alexsdad06 at the RBSG Grand Tasting. Pours a hazy dark brown color with a medium dark head. Good head retention and lacing. Tastes of chocolate, nutty notes, caramel and faint cherry notes. Medium bodied. Very nice.

A very fine brew.  Pours black with moderate carbonation which dissipates quickly.  chocolate and slight smokiness on the nose.  Can really taste the roastiness of the malts.  Chocolate and slight whiskey/alcohol taste. and medium  mouthfeel.  Alcohol is very well hidden.  Is a good combination of an easy drinking beer with great taste and complexity. Very good

Very dark brwon color. Molasses, coffee, dark chocolate, smoke, whiskey, bacon in the nose. Intense. Surprisingly light mouth. Slightly sour. Whiskey, molasses and dark chocolate. Dry. Whiskey, molasses an smoke in the finish.

750ml bottle thanks to Hopscotch. Big thanks for bringing this absolutely STUNNING beer. I knew little about this brewery and I was just blown away by this beer. Nose is rich with malt, huge fruity notes of plum and raisin with chocolate and caramel. Pours a near black with a small long lasting light tan head. Super clean flavor throughout with an almost fudgelike chocolate note and tons of dark fruit flavor. Finishes nutty. As it warms subtle smoke and leather become apparent. Complex as hell this beer. One of the best lagered beers I have ever had. Absolutely fantastic!

Bottle at home ... deep black ... huge bubbly head .... over fizzy... i hate fizz ... little sourness and roast malt nose ... again ahint of sourness ... but not enough to ruin ... big chocolate ... soft roast ... quite tasty ... big chocolate ... ruined by the fizz

En bouteille.  Liquide presque noir, collet brun foncé bien monté et solide.  Au nez, des effluves de malt foncé, du café, du chocolat, de lalcool, définitivement de la réglisse noire, une touche de fruits séchés et macérés, du sucre brûlé, un peu de fumée.  En bouche, même richesse que lon retrouve dans les arômes.  Le départ est doux mais vite complexifié par le goût prédominant du malt rôti.  Finale torréfiée de chocolat, de sucre dorge, de réglisse, de raisin macéré et de petite fumée.  Le liquide est assez robuste et sa texture est soyeuse.  Lalcool se fait définitivement sentir.   En résumé, bière impériale.

750 ml bottle

This has been sitting around for a while since Ughsmash sent me the bottle in a trade. I decided to bring it to share with a few others. It was good enough I might have enjoyed the whole thing alone but why be greedy? Drinking this makes me want to make a trip to the source and try more of their releases.

Aroma / Appearance - Medium chocolate in appearance this had a nice balance to it. Fluid and black it released a combination of ash, smoke, light chocolate, and a sweet smooth base.

Flavor / Palate - Cinnamon, spice, and ash were rounded off by a smoky sweetness. The mouthfeel was simultaneously thick and fluid. The alcohol on this one is masked well and does not really show up until near the final sips. Overall this is a perfect baltic porter and reminds me why I like the style so much.

UPDATED: DEC 28, 2010 on tap at Brouhaha brewpub. pours pitch black with a moka head that leaves lots of lacing. lots of chocolate and roasted malts in the aroma. taste is the same, with a nice sweet cherry flavour to precede the hops in the finish. kind of smokey too. thick on the palate, an oily feel to it. this is a great beer during the cold months of the winter. warms you right up!

A deep dark porter with a thick brown head. In aroma, pleasant moka coffee, chocolate, molasses, and dark fruits. In mouth, a smooth porter with a bitter coffee, prunes, oily mouthfeel, dark chocolate, warming alcohol, exceptional porter. LAutre Oeil edition, probably 2 years old. Tasted Feb. 14, 2010.

750 mL bottle.  (2007 vintage).  Almost black, with a ring of beige head.  The aroma is dominated by roast, but also has a vinuous quality.  The flavour is as good or better than anything Ive tried in this style: roast, chocolate milk, black coffee, berries, and more fruit as it warms.  Not as sweet as some other Baltic porters.  The alcohol is not apparent.  The body is full and creamy.  Excellent beer.
Hard to ask for anything more. Except the palate on the fizzy side, this is by all means the perfect beer. Bold chocolate fruity flavour with a coffee note. Deliciously thick. What a brew.

Bomber from a friend during brew session. 2009 GC. Pours with a huge tan head over the deep, black liquid. Inviting caramel, chocolate, and coffee aroma. Lots of sugary molasses with dried fruit flavor. Roasted coffee and chocolate notes.Alcohol barely peeks through. Perfect brew for a cold drizzly day.
Thanks to Jason for poping this!  Dark viscous pour with a nice cascading tan head.  Aroma is roast & earthy tones.  Full bodied.  Espresso, caramel, spice and chocolate

Bottle courtesy of my Canadian Secret Santa -- thanks!!  Glad to get a second crack at this one.  Pours a roasted coffee color with a nice beige head.  Killer aroma -- almost like this was barrel aged.  Smells and tastes of toasted malt, semi-sweet cocoa, and vanilla.  This really was as good as I drunkenly remember it being the first time.

750 ml Bottle 10.02.05 this is the autumn 2009 cuvee. Dark and mounted by a superb tan head It has an excellent lacing. Aroma : Chocolaty, caramel at first than woody and nutty its pleasant. Bitterness is enough and help making that malt focused beer digestive. Its full in body. Wheres the 10%? I cant perceive any hotness from the alcohol its really smooth and easy to drink. An other fine example beer from that great brewery. Keep the GC coming.

Inviting nose of roast coffee, dark chocolate, anise and brazil nuts, black as coal, pours a teasing little cappuccino head. Flavour is roast coffee, loads of dark chocolate and some liquorice notes too. Full bodied, extremely well balanced, bitter, entirely too drinkable. Majestic!

I was well into the brewing session when I pulled the cork ont htis baby that MartinT sent down to me in trade.  It had begun to drizzle as the sparge ended and the boil began on my smoked porter.  I had been listening to a book on the Revolutionary War.  This elixir plus the cool winter breeze and the freezing drizzle put me in a contemplative mood as I got the burner going for the 75 minute boil.  Pours a a photo eating black.. Light chocolate cocoa nose is interrupted by my hop bag stuffings  for the boil.  CRAP.  Body is elongated but not full as I had expected.  may be that it was a bit on the cool side sitting on the porch.  Not much heat.  Slick finish.  Merci!

Poors an intense black beer. Smells chocolat, coffee with a small presence of smoke. Taste the chocolat with a final in smoke, mayby just a bit too strong. Overall, a great beer that will get even better with some years.
Pours a black tar with a brown froth head.  Aroma is woody malt.  Taste is big, bold roasted malts and a big alcohol bite.  Nice beer.

750 ml bottle.  Pours a very deep woody brown almost charcoal black with a moderate tan head.  Aroma is maple syrup sweetness, with some hints of soy oxidation- sugary sweet, dark candy sugar toasty biscuit and some chocolate- light burnt notes.  Flavor is dark charred malts, brown, toast, nutty biscuit- more soy oxidation- toast, rope, leather earth and herbal light astringent.  Ok.

Whew! good/strong stuff! Deep, strong malt and alcohal smells, lots of earthiness too. Great dark head on pour, thins quickly, not much onlacing. Very dark stuff. STRONG dark maltt flavour, Dark coffe at the end. Nice and foamy on the tounge/throat. Very strong (alc), dark and smooth. A very dark coffeeish malty ale.

Pours Black with a thick beige head Very roasty with notes of chocolate. very malty. Flavour is wild. Lots of chocolate followed by roasted malt followed by chololate all infused with the flavour of the sea.  Rich malty and salty this is an impressive brew! I Love it. It is deep and unique great profile. One of the best beers I have ever had.

Big bottle as part of a gift pack with 2 glasses and another big bottle (maibock). Pours a heavy dark opaque brown with ruby highlights and a thick sturdy brown head. Sweet stewed fruits, chocolate, vanilla all greet the nose. Flavours are port-like in some aspects with raisins, vanilla, and soft woody character all interplaying with chocolate and hints of coffee. Soft, silky mouthfeel, full-bodied, AWESOME!
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Smoke, chocolate, roasted malt. Definite alcohol aftertaste. Great looking pour. Extremely strong and full-bodied beer, perfect example of a baltic porter. Low carbonation, tasted almost flat. Oily feel, oily feel, oily feel, oily feel, oily feel.

2008 Bottle - Thanks Glouglouburp!! - Pour is thick and dark, with a sizeable tan head that dissipates into a small ring....aroma is quite bold, milk chocolate, roasted nuts, molassas and brown sugar, hay and dk fruit, the slightest bit of metal...flavour does not disappoint, rich and thick up front, fudge and coffee, burnt sugar and a little soy, nicely bitter charred wood... complimentary alcohol to cut the richness, finish is more roast with some tart grain that lingers...that was a great surprise...

Bottle that I coerced nbutler11 into opening when we were both at the end of the night, whereupon we each passed out.  Make no mistake, I owe him a bottle.  HOWEVER.  If my mouth was not playing tricks on me, this was the beer of the night.  Nose of almond, coffee, chocolate.  Tastes of the same plus a great vanilla tying it all together.  Smooth and balanced from start to finish.  A world-class beer.

Bottle at Volo 750 ml (2009) 
Appearance:  dark brown , low carbonation , lighter top. 3+
Nose:  brown malts , molasses , ripe dried plum , brown sugar , lightly vineus finishing with alcohol. Well refined. 7+.
Flavor/Palate :  full bodied , sweet with brown malts , mild roast with mild bitter hop sides. Light carbonation. Alcohol is well hidden. Bit thin for Baltic , good complexity and craftsmanship but also to dry for proper Baltic. I think they missed a point here. Baltic Porter should be superbly crafted yet not as complex as this one. The detail is in making simple great. (Please not score not given to the style.)

Bottle.  Very enticing aroma, full of fudgy chocolate, smoke, faint espresso, wood and dark roasty malts, very strong overall.  Thick black color with a lasting tan head.  Flavor features notes of chocolate, raisin, prune, very rich but only semi-sweet, finishing a bit ashy and with fading hints of dark cherry.  Palate is smooth and effervescent, body is medium-full.  Very nice, gives a highly refined impression.  Thanks to Eugene!

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2012 Bottle thanks to GlouglouburpDark brown with a large cream head. Ash, chocolate, nut, and licorice in the nose. More licorice and cocoa in the flavor followed by a light milk chocolate finish. Salty body, creamy and with a sticky finish that lasts in heavy milk chocolate. I prefer more malt and less excess in baltic porters, and the licorice note is a particularly unwelcome note here as it clashes with the sweeter, more subdued elements.

Porter Baltique Grande Cuvée Automne 2009  Towering, not-lasting dark amber-beige head over well-carbonated deep sepia beer. Dark chocolate; sweet, but stale coffee; roasted, herbs, too long in the frying pan. Sweet-burnt, clashing but still combining well in the end; burnt caramel and again parsley aroma. Sweetness flaring, probably due to the alcohol. Retronasal bitter coffee and indistinct hops. Very slick, oily, very well-bodied; slight burning MF. Nice, if not unforgettable porter.  Grand merci à Altair, Betelgeuze et Fomalhaut

750ml bottle @Pauls Gathering courtesy JoeMcPhee-pours a light brown head and black color.  Aroma is dark malt-chocolate/molasses, earthy hops.  Taste is dark malt-chocolate/molasses/ashy, secondary earthy hops.

Thanks to DougShoemaker. Appearance: Jet black, no head. Aroma: lovely leather, smoke, chocolate, lots of coffee & malt. Flavour: Rich chocolate, coffee, lovely texture, long alcoholic warming mouthfeel.

750mL bottle pours jet black with a nice British khaki head. Smells wonderful, roasted malt, some toffee. Tastes like a chocolately malt coffee blend. Really well blended together in the aftertaste, completely hiding the alcohol until it starts to burn a little in your throat. Very good beer
user_location: The World of Beer, Texas, USA

text:
Pours black with a thick mocha head. Gentle aromas of roasted nut and mocha, Very full bodied, smooth, creamy, yummy chocolate and a slight fruitiness. Beautiful winter warmer. I loved it.
On tap at Vices & Versa

Dark black pour with a thick moussey brown head.  The nose is loaded with dark toasted malt.  A touch of dark chocolate and dried cherries over a kiss of soft vineousness.  There is a touch of soft earthy coffee and stewed fruity sweetness.  A light salty/cocoaish roastiness with a fairly savoury charry maltiness.  Plums and licorice over a sweet but roasty finish.  There is a kiss of smokiness on the back as well.  Nice.

Bottle at Pauls place for Kans visit.  Pours a dark black with a thin tan head.  Plum, prune, dark chocolate.  Flavors follow the nose, the dark chocolate is excellent.  Light booze comes through, but nothing overly distracting, just a gentle warming note.  Finishes with some light sweet chocolate.  Really tasty.

Corked and caged 750ml bottle from 2008.  The dark, dense, mahogany colored body is crowned by a tall, billowing head of khaki foam.  Displaying
excellent retention, the froth leaves thick sheets of lacing all over the glass. The aroma is of rich malted chocolate, 
scorched caramel, stewed figs, raisins, and a hefty dose of bready Belgian yeast.  Theres definitely a hint of lactose in there, as the chocolate comes off really creamy, almost milky.  Flavors follow suit, ultra rich cocoa and caramel showing dark and decadent, with loads of fruity complexity.  Figs, dates, and toasted nuts all emerge from the depths, as does a hint of coffee roast.  The palate is initially very thick and creamy, showing just a bit of dryness and a slightly tart twang on the finish from the Belgian yeast.  This is an Excellent Baltic porter.

Rich, tasty, sweet with a nice finish. Chocolate and a sweet tobacco after-taste. Some Hazelnuts have join the party. I am THAT impress.....Bravo, merci milles fois. Ayoye.....ayoye....

750 ml.

Courtesy Beerlando. Pours a thick black with touches of red. Big chocolate, roasted grain, toffee, dark fruit coffee aroma. Taste is dark fruit, bitter chocolate, coffee with a medium thick body. Smooth and tasty, really good Baltic Porter.

Pours a tantalizing jet black with a frothy and stable beige head.  The aroma possesses some strong roasted character with hints of chocolate and molasses.  The beer really comes alive on the palate, heavily bodied yet smooth...really good to swish around in your mouth a few times after each sip.  Opens up with mildly bitter chocolate intermingled with notes of toffees, milkiness, and the usual earthy, nutty flavors you get with some of Les Trois Mousquetaires other selections.  Alcohol is well disguised as always; just a great brew all around.

Courtesy Beerlando. Black/dark ruby. Off white head. Dark, bittersweet chocolate, mild roast, dark and earthy fruits, a bit of booze. Full body, smooth. Nice baltic, these guys do some great malty brews.

750 thanks to Beerlando.  Pours black and opaque.  Very rich creamy and delicious.  Nose is roasty/burnt and malted milk.  The flavor is bitter roasted malts and sweet with hints of bakers chocolate and black liquorice.  A wonderful beer.

UPDATED: DEC 4, 2009 Bottle, 2009 Vintage. Dark pour, with frothy tan head. Aroma is meaty, some smoke, coffee, salt. Taste is meaty as well but with a bit of malty sweetness and alcohol. Very long lingering finish.
Very meaty, bit of smoke in the nose. Really a great baltic porter, roasty with some dark fruit and a salty finish.
0.75 l bottle at PBF. Reddish black color. Sweet, nutty and coffeish aroma. The flavor is also sweet and coffeish with licorice, nuts and caramel. A bit too fizzy palate.

Bottled at PBF (as Porter Baltique).  pale black, rich airy head. Licorice aroma. Sweet and ashy lots of licorice and lemon. Roasty and doughy, some dough and dreid plums. Long salty bitterness. Tasty stuff!

Bottled (as Porter Baltique Automne 2008, 10%). Very dark brown colour with small brown head. Aroma is coffee, malts and some roasted notes. Flavour is burnt sugar, alcohol, coffee, fudge, syrup and some caramel malts. Not much baltic porter in this one. Aftertaste is fudge, roasted malts and alcohol.

Bottled as "Porter Baltique" (PBF, vintage 2008). 
Dark brown color, small brown head, Strong cocoa-chocolate-coffee aroma. Coffeish, roasted malty, caramelly and milky flavor. Similar sweet flavor than in their doppelbock, which I had in the same session. Not really baltic porter.

(Bottled, 0.75l) Very dark brown with a smallish, beige head. Aroma has roasted maltiness, some ash, hints of vegetables and chocolate. Milky-sour flavor with ashes and roasted coffee. Medium body, lowish carbonation. Might get better points if it wasnt 1 AM and if I didnt have about 25 beers before this.

UPDATED: SEP 19, 2010 The best I had I yet had in this style, especially that new 9,2% ABV 2010 batch, with a tremendous depth, quite thick and very malty, with notes of brown sugar and toffee, chocolate, coffee, apricots, wood, leather, smoke, tongue-tingling hoppiness, with a lasting dry espresso-like aftertaste.  The alchool is surprisingly hidden in the taste (although it is quite boozy) and it is all-in-all very well balanced.  Probably my favorite beer from this talented brewer (with their amazing 2010 Imperial Weizen).

Big bottle "Fall 2008". Big pop! 80% foam in the glass looks like a block of brown styrofoam. Head doesnt sink so much as it becomes porous. Black liquid. Big dark chocolate aroma. A strong sweetness in the first few sips. Big bitter chocolate. Alcohol blends right in. Hints of licorice. Lots of chocolate turns to more of a cocoa note in the finish.
Pours black with dark head.  Taste is licorice, a little sourness.  Solid porter with above average mouthfeel.  Carbonation is apparent.  Drinkable stuff, though not exceptional baltic porter.

750ml bottle. Poured black with brown head, no retention. Very nice looking. Aroma is roasted malt. Taste is same as aroma. Very well balanced. Finsih is bittery coffee. Well made but not quite my type. Rating #111
Nice beer!  Black pour and a brown head.  Chocolate, molasses, prunes on the nose.  Flavor is creamy with some chocolate, and some nice light hop bitterness.  Really a good beeer.
Bottle thx Dak! Black with tan fizzy head. Fruity aroma. Flavors are excellent with lots of licorice adding the sweetness, natural cocoa, remaining brilliantly fruity throughout.
Porter Baltique.  Very dark brown.  Chocolate aroma with light nuts.  Light chocolate, fudge...theres a vibrancy to it as well.  It has style with that juicy acidity.  Pretty good.

750ml caged-corked bottle

Decants a lush black roily lager into the glass,... with a massive mocha-colored cap that laces well.

Decadent aroma of  rich chocolate-fudge over aromatic dried fruit and coffee. light leafy tones. This aroma is pungent and fills the room with a bready-cocoa aroma.

Medium to heavy bodied, rich silky mouth, chocolate cake character.

Flavor profile whacks you with a big chew on toasty-chocolaty-mocha malts, some sweetness...mid palate you get dried fruit and complexity....long wet finish with lush cocoa-bready-roasted husk tastes...totally hides the alcohol...far better than Okocim...magnificent!

Bottle shared by after4ever. Dark brown with a minimal head. The aroma is lots of dark roast, chocolate, and coffee. SOme dark fruit. Lots of roast and dark fruit flavors, some alcohol, light finish. Maybe a little too boozy for me, but still pretty nice stuff here.

750ml cork and caged bottle from glouglouburp, thanks Dany. Pours a solid chocolate brown with a huge foamy beige head.  Flavor of dark fruits, slight alcohol, chocolate and some licorice. Dusty aroma with notes of bitter baker chocolate, rum cake and chocolate covered cherries. The aroma was okay but the flavor was a nice step up and this is one solid beer.

Thanks to Dmac for sharing this one. Pours out dark brown, almost black with a small slightly lacing head. Aroma is some roasted malts, caramel, and some other subtle sweet notes, little weak on the aroma. Taste is complex and very well balanced. Chocolate, roast, caramel, dried fruit and maybe some coffee in there too. Extremely well balanced, top notch.

750ml from Glouglouburp - thanks, Dany! Very thick dark brown pour, with a lively carbonation that yields an active frothy head and lingering lace. More roasts in the nose than Id expected, but not at the expense of a deep chocolate aroma. The mouthfeel is pleasantly thick, and the creamy lactic qualities complement rather than clash with the roasted malts. A trace hoppy and prickly, unlike some examples of the style. Slightly chalky finish and a lovely fruit complement to the sweet chocolate milk character. Delish!
